Title: Data Analyst, Supply Chain Analytics
FullDescriptions:
Senior Analyst, Visibility & Analytics
We are building the best in class digital freight forwarding platform and this group leads the creation of solutions to drive competitive differentiation and productivity improvement for Wayfair. This group interacts closely with Product, Engineering, Business Intelligence and Operations teams to perform analytics and provide visibility by building reporting solutions to the operations organization.
What You'll Do
Partner with internal customers (e. g. Ocean, Dray, Billing, Compliance, Asia) to identify the most impactful ways for data and analytics to drive decision making and accelerate profitable growth
Comprehend, extract, and massage information from large data sources to deliver business insights and recommendations
Become the subject matter expert for data and analytics within the business unit to ensure accurate and proper interpretation of core business metrics and consumer behavior
Perform deep-dive analysis, including the application of advanced analytical techniques, to solve some of the more critical and complex business problems around supply chain optimization
Develop data visualizations, including reports, dashboards, and analysis using BI solutions to distribute data insights in an easily digestible manner
Mentor and guide analysts in the team and help build a strong team
What You'll Need
Experience in analytics, business intelligence, data science or engineering role performing quantitative analysis
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.) or other structured programming language(s) (e.g. Python, Java, C)
Hands-on experience conducting quantitative analyses on large data sets. Experience with Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.) and Tableau a plus
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems
Strong written and verbal communication
BA/BS or Masters in Computer Science, Economics, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or other quantitative discipline field with strong academic record
Experience with RDBMS, Big data technology, OLAP technologies
Experience with Python, Java, C++
Experience working in supply chain operations is a plus
About Us
Wayfair is one of the world s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That s why we re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Qualifications: Education toward such a degree or diploma will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.
FullDescriptions:
ABOUT DTA


The Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA) assists and empowers low-income individuals and families to meet their basic needs, improve their quality of life, and achieve long term economic self-sufficiency. DTA serves one in eight residents of the Commonwealth with direct economic assistance (cash benefits) and food assistance (SNAP benefits), as well as workforce training opportunities.

This is a provisional appointment.

POSITION OVERVIEW

We are seeking qualified applicants for the position of Senior Data Analyst. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for using technical expertise to analyze policy, financial, and operational data from a wide range of data sets to produce informed policy decisions; ensuring data integrity and promoting transparency; using primary research and statistical methods to inform analyses; and compiling and communicating findings to non-technical leadership to minimize anecdotal responses in favor of data-driven solutions. The duties will include but are not limited to:
Assist with the development and implementation of various monitoring reports for DTA Management. Performs on-demand report generation, ad-hoc queries and analytic tasks.
Write and revise complex SQL queries using optimization design patterns to minimize negative impact to database resources.
Extract data using TOAD, Cognos Analytics, and Tableau to provide data and data analysis for internal and external stakeholders.
Provide analytical support to time sensitive projects and operations changes, working directly with senior leadership.
Apply basic and intermediate statistical methods to validate data and develop statistical models Develop systems and strategies for utilizing internal and external databases and other data sources for policy, program and procedure evaluation.
Become a subject matter expert on all program metrics, data sets and trends.
Deconstruct and evaluate current Agency functions and recommend, implement and evaluate changes by generating analytic reports.
End-to-end validation using Oracle SQL, Python, and Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, aggregate functions, IF statements) to ensure comprehensive data integrity.
Proficient in advanced data modeling, including multiple regression techniques, have experience with test design and execution, and experience with analytic surveying techniques
Identification of the correct data, analysis, or approach to translate complex business problems into insights and actionable recommendations
Deduce meaning of analyses and distribute the information back to senior level staff. Identify trends and patterns that can inform predictive analytics.
Assume independent responsibility for tasks given to the analyst by their manager. Demonstrate ability to research and understand previously unknown subject matter to accomplish the task.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge and expertise in practical statistical sampling theory and application, data collection and analysis. methodologies, and electronic data processing applications.
Knowledge of statistical software to conduct various analysis
At least four years of professional experience using relational database tools to extract data and turn that data into an analytical form (i.e. reports, charts, graphs)
Advanced knowledge of Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, LOOKUP formulas), SQL and data visualization skills (Tableau, Cognos), ODBC sources, Oracle, SAS, and/or Toad
Working knowledge of R and/or Python
Working knowledge of the DTA public assistance programs (TANF/TAFDC, EAEDC, SNAP, employment services) and BEACON data warehouse
Knowledge of federal and state laws and regulations governing the functions of the agency
Ability to analyze and determine the applicability of data, draw meaningful conclusions and make appropriate recommendations
Ability to promote and support data improvement, innovation, communication and integration efforts
Detail-oriented and have a sense of urgency; self-starters who possess the intellectual curiosity to be a systematic problem solver
Knowledge of Performance Management with the ability to design and implement data collection, research, evaluation, quality management and accountability processes
Ability to distill complex data into succinct reports (in a manner appropriate and comprehensible to various audiences) leading to conclusions, recommendations and/or action items
Knowledge of project management theory and practice with the ability to design and manage process for coordinating the prioritization of projects; ability to track the progress of each project and identify project improvement opportunities and strategies
Skilled in problem solving, consensus building and team building with the ability to manage a number of projects simultaneously to successful completion
Knowledge of dashboard creation and production
Knowledge of program improvement, innovation and integration strategies
Ability to present facts, data, and recommendations effectively in oral and written form
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Ability to communicate in writing and orally with superiors and subordinates, with the public and state officials
Ability to mediate conflicts, coordinate competing interests, work under time constraints, and adjust to varying or changing situations to meet emergency or changing program requirements
Ability to exercise discretion in handling confidential information
Ability to exercise sound judgment


Pre-Offer Process:
A criminal background check will be completed on the recommended candidate as required by the regulations set forth by the Executive Office of Health and Human Services prior to the candidate being hired. For more information, please visit http://www.mass.gov/hhs/cori and click on "Information for Job Applicants".

Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division’s Hiring Guidelines.

Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth’s website.

For questions, please contact the Office of Human Resources at 1-800-510-4122 and select option #2.

Qualifications

First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.

Minimum Entrance Requirements:

Applicants must have at least (A) five years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in electronic data processing, of which (B) at least three years must have been in work in which the major duties included computer systems analysis, or (C) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.

SUBSTITUTIONS:

I. An Associate's degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

II. A Bachelor's degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer and/or information science may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required (A) experience.*

III. A Graduate degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer and/or information science may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required (A) experience.*

IV. A diploma for completion of a two year full-time, or equivalent part-time, program in a recognized non-degree granting business or vocational/technical school above the high school level with a major in the field of computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

V. An official transcript from a recognized business or vocational/ technical school as evidence of completion of a program consisting of at least 650 hours of instruction in the field of computer programming maybe substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

VI. Graduation from the data processing course of a recognized vocational/technical high school may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.

Education toward such a degree or diploma will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.
NOTE: No substitution will be allowed for more than two years of the required (A) experience.

NOTE: No substitution will be allowed for the three years of the required (B) experience.

Special Requirements: None.

An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Title: Statistician - Data Scientist
FullDescriptions:
Are you passionate about transforming data into insights?

Would you like to partner with UX professionals and Data Analysts who are constantly solving new and challenging problems?

Are you interested in being a core member of team that’s piloting new metrics, research methods, and statistical techniques to explore and visualize user experience as well as business processes?

If you answered yes to these questions, we want to talk with you. Learn more about our group!
Responsibilities
As part of the Analysis and Insights team within the UX group, you will be responsible for developing, piloting, and analyzing data that helps us measure and visualize the user experience. We are looking for someone who can seamlessly blend qualitative and quantitative data to deliver actionable insights that help engender great product designs. You will work with developers, data analysts, designers, and more cross-functional team members to find opportunities to brainstorm and develop innovative data solutions to complex problems.
Identify, make recommendations, and pilot new metrics that assess UX, design quality, and organizational health.
Design, prototype, and develop dashboards that visualize customer data
Use statistical and machine learning techniques to identify meaningful customer insights in complex data sets
Help the teams interpret and understand user feedback, and provide input for design decisions based on that feedback.
Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor's degree and 5 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree) is required.
Expertise with Statistics
Familiar with user experience
Expertise with Machine learning
Experience with Agile software development
Additional Qualifications
STEM Degree is preferred (Engineering, Experimental Psychology, Computer Science, etc.)
3+ years as a data analyst, data scientist, quantitative researcher, usability engineer, or other equivalent title
Experience with survey design, validation, and large-scale sampling methods
At least one of the following:
Knowledgeable about statistical techniques, machine learning, and database querying
Regression (logistic, stepwise, multiple, etc.)
Classification and Dimensionality reduction (PCA, factor analysis)
Marketbasket analyses
SQL
Knowledge of MathWorks products (MATLAB/Simulink)
Knowledge of domains where MathWorks products are used
Knowledge of a variety of usability methods
Ability to balance needs of a large number of concurrent projects and work effectively with cross-functional teams


Plusses:

Knowledge of Power BI
Experience using Bayesian methods
Experimental design and quantitative research techniques
Metrics development, including identifying KPIs

Title: Business Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
What we do
Customer Portfolios is a marketing technology leader that empowers its global retail clients to maximize the value of each customer. The company's marketing platform offers a single digital solution that brings together all customer data to enable analysis, insight, strategy, and execution.
Who we are
The Customer Portfolios team of analytical and marketing experts help companies like Johnston & Murphy, Journeys, Frye, Tourneau, and many more consistently drive revenue growth and increased customer lifetime value. Visit www.customerportfolios.com, read our blog and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.
Who you are
Love Databases and Data Visualizations – You enjoy writing SQL to gather your data points and making them come alive through Tableau data visualization
Compelling Storyteller – As an analyst, you know that the beauty is in the details, but you also understand how each piece of the analytics puzzle fits together to form actionable recommendations that will knock your clients' socks off
Curious – You want to know why a program performs well or doesn't and don't mind getting your hands dirty when tackling the underlying data
Innovator – You take pride in building things and seeing your ideas through to the end-product, whether it's a Tableau dashboard, an Excel output, or an elegant SQL code solution
Adaptable – You are flexible and understand that clients' needs can change mid-task. You enjoy wearing many hats and working on multiple projects at the same time.
Team Player – You like working closely with others and thrive in team settings
What you'll do
Strategically own client projects from beginning to end as the expert analyst on the team
Develop quantitative analysis, dashboards, and ad hoc reporting to demonstrate performance of key business initiatives and define areas for optimization
Synthesize complex analytics into compelling top level findings for presentations to senior marketing executives
Work with data engineers and solution architects to source new data, resolve system issues that impede data extraction, and design structures which will best support analytical efforts
Work with internal and client-marketing teams to define and execute A/B and multivariate tests to optimize the customer experience and maximize customer value
Comfortable sharing expertise with other team members and leading new analytical initiatives
Your Experience
3+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with proven success in designing analytical approaches to understand key business behaviors that drive acquisition, retention, and engagement
Proficiency in SQL– on the job experience collaborating with architects on table design to support Tableau reporting and ad hoc requests. The bulk of our work is done in SQL.
Proficiency in Tableau – on the job experience with creating dynamic Tableau dashboards

Title: Data Visualization Manager
FullDescriptions:
Data Visualization Manager
9798BR
Finance
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Over the last three years, Finance and IT have partnered to design and implement an enterprise reporting platform led by the Business Intelligence & Reporting (BIR) function. The team has delivered an on-premises enterprise data warehouse, master data management tool and reporting suite—serving as a single source of reporting truth for financial and operational reporting.

We are in the early stages of a journey to build a centralized Business Intelligence & Analytics Center of Excellence that will simplify and automate our information delivery through a shared digital platform; this will greatly enhance how our leaders engage in information required to manage the business. To date, the team has launched and operationalize several global dashboards. The next wave of digital reporting is underway which will help to unlock further value for BCG functions and leadership with best in class business intelligence and analytics.

This individual will strategize and lead innovative reporting solutions within Business Intelligence & Reporting. The candidate will bring a wealth of knowledge on both the automation and scaling of digital reporting solutions. The role will manage across the development life cycle including gathering business requirements, authoring functional designs, overseeing / creating prototypes, ensuring quality and performance and consistency across global dashboards.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
Strategic thought leadership with an ability to inform and influence senior leadership decisions on dashboard analytics and visualizations.
Partner to the business, understanding key questions and helping to storyboard answers
Expert at visualizing and presenting data in an engaging, interactive, and informative ways.
Strong analytical skills demonstrating creative problem solving gathering and synthesizing information from multiple sources.
Hands-on experience with Tableau or other visualization tools including designing, testing, administering security, and optimization.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
7-10+ years’ experience designing and implementing reporting solutions including interactive dashboards preferably in a consulting role; less experience considered for exceptional performers
Experience leading / supporting an analytics transformation with demonstrated results simplifying end-user experience by implementing self-service reporting solutions
Ability to translate reporting needs into user-centric dashboards including UX design experience and deep understanding of user-centered design (UCD)
Tableau experience is preferred (Qualified Associate or Certified Professional), but mastery of similar systems with transferrable skillsets (Alteryx, PowerBI, R, Python, etc.) are acceptable.
Knowledge and understanding of implementing end-to-end security solutions within tableau server and leveraging / designing necessary database-level security
Proficiency in SQL to access data warehouses including select statements and joins
Experience developing and mentor individuals analytics skillset, enabling them in providing data-driven insights to the business
Experience working with Agile development methodologiesBasic finance knowledge of financials statements including P&L, Balance Sheet, etc. is preferred.Proven ability to work effectively in a global environment with people at all levels, preferably in a professional services organization
YOU'LL WORK WITH
As a member of the Business Intelligence & Reporting team, you will interact extensively with a diverse range of stakeholders from across the business, both geographically and functionally. The role sits within the overall Global Financial Planning & Analysis team, coordinating and working with our Analysis, Planning, and Accounting systems teams will play a large part in this role.

Boston

United States

WHO WE ARE
BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.

FullDescriptions:
/Overview

The Senior Data Analyst, Analytics, Reporting, and Insights (ARI) is responsible for identifying, querying, analyzing, and presenting through reports and presentations, a variety of data to support quality and performance measurement initiatives throughout Brigham and Women’s and Brigham and Women’s Faulkner Hospitals. This will require close collaboration with staff within the clinical departments, and many other analytic, quality, financial, and business planning groups throughout the hospital. Data and reporting support could encompass areas such as patient satisfaction survey programs, quality and patient safety reporting, clinical outcome performance tracking, asset utilization and measurement support, finance, business development, and others. The successful Senior Data Analyst will analyze and organize complex qualitative and quantitative clinical, financial and administrative data from multiple data sources, and synthesize results into meaningful reports and presentations on a regular basis, leveraging Tableau tools, SQL querying and Excel analysis, Epic reporting tools such as reporting workbench and radar, as well as other tools such as R, SAS, and Python. S/he will leverage their skills working with large data sets, distilling data down into digestible information, for consumption by hospital senior leadership and staff across the organization. They will serve as a resource and role model for other ARI data analysts, and train other analysts and end-users on core analytic and reporting capabilities.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities
Elicits data and reporting requirements from hospital leadership, clinicians, and other staff, using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, use cases, scenarios, data analysis, task, and workflow analysis.

Determines appropriate tools to meet the end user’s data and reporting needs, inclusive of Brigham Health’s Epic reporting tools such as Radar, Reporting Workbench, Clarity and Caboodle, as well as adhoc data analysis through querying the Brigham Health data warehouse and delivering via Excel or PowerPoint, or developing Tableau dashboards for historical, analytical reporting.

Performs data analysis against hospital systems such as our electronic medical record system (Epic), enterprise data warehouse (EDW), Balanced Scorecard, SAS data sets, MS Access databases, external websites, and Tableau in order to glean meaningful insights and produce actionable reports for internal customers.

Presents data and analyses to key stakeholder groups as requested, including creating materials for and giving presentations as needed.

Works with ARI staff in design, maintenance, and distribution of reports while also overseeing ad hoc data analyses and new report development as needed.

Works with Analytics, Reporting, and Insights team to support, maintain and further develop our analytical capabilities with SAS, Tableau, and other analytic platforms, which includes but not limited to dashboard and report development, QA of existing reports, and documentation of system functionality.

Performs comprehensive quality assurance, ensuring that databases and reports meet end user specifications and data are accurate and reliable.

Works with new and existing ARI analysts to share knowledge in methods of data analysis, summarization and presentation. Trains other analysts and end-users on key analytic and reporting systems and databases.

Perform data cleansing and data entry tasks as necessary to support data analysis and reporting.

Represents ARI on internal and external committees or task forces as needed.

Performs all other related duties as required.

Qualifications

Skills and Abilities
Strong proficiency with Excel, manipulating large data sets and synthesizing into digestible information.
Experience with querying relational databases as well building dashboards and reports using business intelligence tools such as Tableau (preferred), MicroStrategy, SAP Business Objects, Cognos, etc.

Strong ability to work effectively with senior level management, and staff at all levels within an organization.

Experience with data manipulation, cleansing, and statistical analysis using tools such as SAS, R, Python, Power BI, and other tools.

Ability to clearly communicate complex and sensitive data to senior executives as well as peers.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor message to individuals and audiences throughout the institution.

Strong organizational skills, with the ability to focus detailed concentrated effort to multiple projects and re-establish priorities as necessary.

Possesses initiative and ability to work independently while thriving in a setting requiring collaboration and teamwork for maximal efficiency and effectiveness.

Attention to detail that ensures follow through on all initiatives implemented, and all projects undertaken.

Ability to effectively respond to time sensitive issues and meet deadline
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in management, information systems, statistics, or equivalent experience.

At least 3-5 years of experience, preferably in a related analytics position.

Working knowledge of SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau , Business Objects, SAS BI, or others preferred.

Knowledge and application of statistical analyses including financial variance analysis and statistical significance preferred.

Some knowledge of electronic medical record system data preferred.

Project management skills and/or experience a plus.

MS Access and/or SQL Server database experience a plus.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

Title: Clinical Research Analyst
Qualifications:
Master of Science or PhD degree in Clinical Informatics, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health, Bioinformatics, or a related discipline. Exceptional candidates without advanced degrees may be considered.
Working knowledge of relational databases and database structures is key.
Experience with cloud computing in Google Cloud or AWS is strongly preferred.
Must have demonstrated proficiency with at least one of the following computer languages/environments: SAS, SQL, R, Python, Unix, Java, HTML, Matlab, R, C, C++.
Experience with traditional epidemiological and biostatistical modeling methods, including time to event analysis, prediction modeling, and absolute risk modeling is required.
Experience with statistical methods for high dimensional data analysis and disease classification algorithms.
Experience with natural language processing is encouraged.
Experience with electronic health records research or claims data is strongly encouraged.
Ability to work independently while making necessary connections with experts in various computational analysis groups.
Willing to commit to a two-year position. Postdoctoral fellowship positions may be three years or longer.
Self-starter, highly motivated.
Entrepreneurial spirit.
Excellent communication skills.
Excellent organization and time management skills.
FullDescriptions:
Summarize the nature and level of work performed.

The Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) and the Corrigan Minehan Heart Center are seeking a highly motivated Clinical Research Data Analyst and Manager interested in helping curate, organize, and analyze large-scale multimodal electronic health record data for a novel research initiative. The objectives of the research are to leverage machine learning and artificial intelligence to determine the causes of and identify individuals at risk for cardiovascular disease. Insights from this initiative are ultimately expected to lead to improvements in health outcomes.
The candidate will work with a team of investigators at MGH and the Broad Institute including physician scientists, computational biologists, epidemiologists, statisticians, bioinformaticians, computer scientists, and machine learning engineers. The candidate will work with electronic health record data spanning a research repository containing up to 6 million records. Fields will span diagnostic, medication, notes, laboratory, electrocardiographic, imaging, and genomic data.
Ideal candidates will have expertise in clinical informatics and database management, as well as data analysis, and will be highly motivated and eager to learn about cardiovascular disease. Experience with genetics would be advantageous but is not required. Exceptional organizational and interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks are essential. The candidate must be self-motivated, independent in task completion, and comfortable accepting feedback and guidance from colleagues. A high level of discipline and adherence to confidentiality is essential, as the analyst is given access to personal and confidential medical information.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Indicate key areas of responsibility, major job duties, special projects and key objectives for this position. These items should be evaluated throughout the year and included in the written annual evaluation.

Specific responsibilities will include the following:
Provide clinical data analysis and management support to the investigative team.
Curate and organize electronic medical record data from multiple sources and repositories.
Create and maintain longitudinal health record and curated disease-specific datasets.
Perform data analysis against hospital systems to glean meaningful insights and produce actionable reports for team.
Develop and implement electronic phenotyping algorithms for electronic health record data.
Apply traditional and novel epidemiologic and statistical methods to identify disease risk factors and analyze relations between risk factors and health outcomes.
Work with research information security and IRB to ensure compliance and adherence to institutional, federal, and other security, regulatory, and compliance policies relating to health data management.
Participate in the development of clinical research documents (eg. Protocols, Case Report Forms, Reports and Statistical Analysis Plans) where relevant.
Develop a Data Management Plan (DMP) for studies, maintain DMP throughout lifecycle of study projects, and ensure DMP is followed according to study design and requirements.
Develop database data specifications, including user requirements, edit rules/checks, query logic and data validations.
Work with investigative team and Principal Investigator to support, maintain and further develop our analytical capabilities which includes but is not limited to dashboard and report development, QA of existing reports, and documentation of system functionality.
Work with project manager to ensure data access is provisioned in accordance with protocol approvals.
Assist and provide input into study and project level data analysis plan.
Collaborate with IT and implementation team(s) to address Clinical application requests and/or changes to Clinical database systems.
Participate within a team of scientists to foster a culture of scientific excellence.
Work with coinvestigators, postdoctoral fellows, research analysts, research nurses, and other team members to execute approved protocols.

Qualifications

SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED: Must be realistic, objective, measurable and related to essential functions of this job.
Master of Science or PhD degree in Clinical Informatics, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health, Bioinformatics, or a related discipline. Exceptional candidates without advanced degrees may be considered.
Working knowledge of relational databases and database structures is key.
Experience with cloud computing in Google Cloud or AWS is strongly preferred.
Must have demonstrated proficiency with at least one of the following computer languages/environments: SAS, SQL, R, Python, Unix, Java, HTML, Matlab, R, C, C++.
Experience with traditional epidemiological and biostatistical modeling methods, including time to event analysis, prediction modeling, and absolute risk modeling is required.
Experience with statistical methods for high dimensional data analysis and disease classification algorithms.
Experience with natural language processing is encouraged.
Experience with electronic health records research or claims data is strongly encouraged.
Ability to work independently while making necessary connections with experts in various computational analysis groups.
Willing to commit to a two-year position. Postdoctoral fellowship positions may be three years or longer.
Self-starter, highly motivated.
Entrepreneurial spirit.
Excellent communication skills.
Excellent organization and time management skills.
LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS (if applicable): Specify minimum credentials and clearly indicate if preferred or required
Not applicable
EDUCATION: Specify minimum education and clearly indicate if preferred or required

Bachelor’s degree required, master’s degree or doctorate preferred. Coursework in health informatics, computer science, mathematics, biostatistics, epidemiology or related fields preferred.
EXPERIENCE: Specify minimum creditable years of experience and clearly indicate if preferred or required

Experience working in an analytic environment for 1 or 2 years preferred. 2 years of prior research experience is required.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable): List the number of FTEs supervised.

Not applicable
FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable): Indicate financial “scope” information, i.e.: size of budget, volume, revenue, etc.; Indicate total physician/non-physician FTE scope

Not applicable
WORKING CONDITIONS: Describe the conditions in which the work is performed.

Regular office conditions. Remote office work also possible.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Flexible Schedule, 30-40 hours/week
FullDescriptions:
The Harvard/MGH Center on Genomics, Vulnerable Populations, and Health Disparities, Massachusetts General Hospital (directed by Alexandra Shields, PhD, Associate Professor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School) conducts research addressing the intersections of genomics research and the interests of minority and other underserved communities. The Sr. Data Analyst for the Center (a 30-40 hour/wk position) serves as the Director of Data for the Study on Stress, Spirituality, and Health (a product of the international Consortium on Psychosocial Stress, Spirituality, and Health), an investigation into the impact of psychosocial stress on risk of chronic disease via methylation analyses of genes in the stress pathway and telomere length, as well as the potential buffering effect of spirituality and coping. The Sr. Data Analyst will supervise a one full-time masters-level Data Analyst, one part-time Research Assistant, and several temp statisticians and interns. The Sr. Data Analyst will report directly to Dr. Alexandra Shields and collaborate with one Sr. Project Manager, one Assistant Professor, and two post-doctoral fellows.

Relevant activities include, but are not limited to the following:
1. Coordination of final survey data collection and quality control from cohort studies participating in an international Consortium;
2. Management of a database consisting of psychosocial, clinical, biomedical data from external collaborators;
3. Harmonizing data elements from six national cohorts for use in statistical analyses of chronic disease outcomes and intermediate biomarkers;
4. Coordinating with external users of Consortium data regarding data requests, access approval, and data delivery and access;
5. Recruitment, training, developing and supervising analyst-level staff;
6. Managing and optimizing processes for data acquisition, transfer, validation, and cleaning;
7. Coordinating with study team to direct resources for multiple research projects including development of datasets for external users, assigning analytic tasks to Data Analyst and temp statisticians as necessary, and
8. Leading the conduct of cross-sectional and longitudinal statistical analyses psychosocial and R/S factors in relation to telomere length, DNA methylation, and chronic disease endpoints utilizing harmonized Consortium data


Qualifications

1. Bachelor’s degree (preferably in epidemiology, statistics, or related field) with 5 years of experience; OR an advanced degree (preferably in epidemiology, statistics, or related field) with 2 years of experience required. Master’s or doctorate candidates preferred.
2. Proficient in programming language required (preferably SAS or R)
3. 5+ years of experience in data analysis, statistic modeling, data management, data visualization, etc.
4. Can effectively coach/counsel employees to successful performance
5. Can effectively communicate with collaborating organizations to ensure data acquisition, transfer and validation
6. Can lead statistical analyses of epidemiological studies

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Responsibilities:
Lend a helping hand in other business insights team initiatives such as predictive analytics and business intelligence report and dashboard creation
Collaborate with operations team on knowledge management and training initiatives that involve data and analytics
Provide consulting support to Framework colleagues regarding data management and data quality
FullDescriptions:
About the Team

The Jr Data Analyst will be a member of the Business Insights team, which exists to provide Framework with a central hub of expertise and resources for evolving data and analytic decision-making needs. From data governance to data-driven decision making, the Business Insights team stewards the collection of data and delivery of key business insights.

About the Role

The Jr Data Analyst is a key member of a data-centric team that drives the creation, implementation, and evaluation of analytical solutions that are imperative to providing Framework customers and colleagues with state-of-the-art data insights. The Jr Data Analyst is responsible for overseeing the verification, data validation and documentation of data internally generated from key technological systems at Framework. In addition, the Jr Data Analyst leads efforts to share timely, relevant and concise data architecture related information to colleagues and teams across the organizations. With support of the Business Insights Manager and the Data Analyst, the Jr Data Analyst will help establish and maintain Framework’s data quality efforts across all systems including but not limited to Salesforce, ThinkingCap, MarketingCloud, Postgres, etc.

This role requires a commitment to developing understanding of Framework’s internal data environment while pursuing a curiosity for different opportunities to use that knowledge. The role requires fierce organization, unparalleled attention to detail and strong communication skills. A successful candidate will possess technical understanding of data management techniques, the ability to implement data quality best practices and the interest in growing their experience across data related work. In this role, you have the opportunity to get into the details while still thinking strategically about our general data management vision and needs.
The ideal candidate is motivated by top notch data quality, curious about inconsistencies, a deep analytical thinker and a process centered individual. They are comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment and envision themselves growing into resident experts in their fields. This is a position with great opportunity for professional development and growth.

This position reports to the Business Insights Manager and is located in Boston, MA.

What You'll Do
Develop, revamp and maintain Framework’s data dictionaries as related to individual products and the business intelligence tool
Manage and execute the process of data verification and data validation for Framework’s business intelligence tool
Document relevant data architecture context for Framework’s key data processes, regular reporting and product systems such as our learning management system, mobile application, etc.
Document relevant data context for external systems used by Framework team such as Google Playstore, iOS App store, ZenDesk call system, Google Analytics, etc.
Support colleagues in efforts to implement data quality standards across the organization
Collaborate with engineering and information system teams to implement data quality initiatives through innovative approaches
Additional Responsibilities
Lend a helping hand in other business insights team initiatives such as predictive analytics and business intelligence report and dashboard creation
Collaborate with operations team on knowledge management and training initiatives that involve data and analytics
Provide consulting support to Framework colleagues regarding data management and data quality
What You'll Bring
0-2 years of recent experience in a data management, data analyst or business analyst. Preferably with understanding of data management techniques.
Bachelor’s degree required; a focus on data management, data sciences, or related subject. Interest in data, or predictive analytics is a bonus.
Programming and technology skills in SQL, Python, R, SSIS development, ETL maintenance are a plus, bash scripting or any shell scripting, Microsoft Excel formulas and macros.
Exposure to CRM tools, business enterprise software analytics, etc.
Familiarity with database modeling and data warehousing principles is required.
Ability to communicate with key technical and business leads in a concise and yet thorough manner.
Familiarity with agile project management and development methods such as scrum.
You are not afraid of a constantly changing, somewhat unpredictable, fast-paced environment. Bonus: this excites you!
Our vision inspires you!
Job Classification

This is a full-time, non-exempt position.

Work Environment and Physical Demands

This job requires the routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. It requires the ability to speak and hear in person, over the phone, and in settings where there are groups of people. Occasional travel is required, including overnight travel for up to four days at a time and travel via airplane.

About the Company

Framework is a startup social enterprise built on a simple idea: every homebuyer should have access to unbiased information about the mortgage process and feel knowledgeable about the responsibilities of owning a home throughout their homeownership journey. We are proudly pro-homeownership and believe it’s a uniquely accessible and powerful way for people to plant and grow seeds of generational wealth. We make it easier for people to do this by providing the tools we believe will lead people into homes that improve their quality of life, giving them the space to grow into their future, and gain value over time. We’re dedicated to helping our customers make decisions with confidence, build wealth in their homes, and protect their investment for generations to come.
As we leverage the power of technology to strengthen communities one homeowner at a time, the individual contributions of our tight-knit team play a vital, daily role in shaping our products and services. Creative thinking, collaboration, and problem solving are at the core of the Framework culture, and we’re seeking team members with drive and creativity to add to the mix.


The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet Framework’s changing needs, at the sole discretion of management.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
FullDescriptions:
JOB SUMMARY: The Business Analyst serves as the front-line resource in managing and defining data requests and requirements for the DentaQuest enterprise. The incumbent supports our Sales team and Clients by being a technical point of contact to set expectations, provide updates and drive implementations through to completion. Support IT goals and objectives by working closely with internal Scrum team members and Stakeholders to ensure that integrations and implementations exceed Client expectations. Work within a distributed team to document, prioritize, develop, test and release small to large scale EDI solutions with Clients located across the country.

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Demonstrated ability to drive to deadlines, balancing multiple priorities, and ensuring quality standards.
Provide strategic analysis to define and improve standard solutions, standard deliverables and templates.
Work with IT and business users to evaluate data and extract requests and recommend viable short and long term solutions.
Ability to work on large and small scale projects for new business implementations and for maintaining existing client implementations with a significant focus on dental encounters, claims, eligibility and enrollment via 837, 835, 999, 834, 277 EDI standards.
Ability to document and maintain requirements using source to target maps, data dictionary, process documentation and team defined standards; using tools such as Visio, Word and Excel.
Ability to perform ad hoc data analysis and reconciliation using complex SQL queries.
Working knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Ensure data quality through scenario based testing.
Other duties as needed or required.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

Required:

BS or equivalent and 2 years’ experience in computer sciences or related field, or equivalent combination.
Must have 2 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Business Analyst, Systems Analyst or Data Analyst.
Must have demonstrated progressive levels of responsibility, experience and leadership.
Excellent organization and prioritization skills with strong ability to shift focus as necessary to meet deadlines.
Excellent interpersonal, listening, oral and written communication skills.
Ability to communicate technical details to technical and non-technical resources.
Ability to facilitate a conference call, WEBEX, in-person meeting with clients and internal team members.
Knowledge of dental or medical insurance claims processing.
Familiarity with appropriate handling of Personal Health Information (PHI) data.
Required to attend additional training as requested/deemed necessary.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Incumbent must be able to communicate effectively.
Requires overall light physical effort (up to 25lbs.)
Manual dexterity and sitting is required in carrying out position own position responsibilities (i.e. use of personal computer).
Ability to travel or move about within and outside serviced facilities required.
Incumbent works primarily in either a private or shared office environment.

At DentaQuest, we believe that everyone should live life free of dental disease. As a purpose-driven, double bottom line company that is improving oral health for everyone, we are transforming the oral health system – from the way we provide care and pay for it, to how we talk about it and prioritize it in our policies and communities.

Meaningful change requires a revolution in oral health. We are redefining what it means to prevent disease and provide better access to care for everyone. We are going beyond the dental chair to reshape the oral health system, addressing total health and the social and cultural factors that impact it.

To make this revolution a reality, we harness our unique reach and insights to advance policy, financing, care, and the community. That means solving problems in a flexible and efficient way, testing and trialing to create new solutions and delivering measurable outcomes for the people we serve.

The people of DentaQuest have a common purpose, and we work together with passion, perseverance and focus to achieve a nation where no child suffers from the pain of tooth decay. Where adults keep all their teeth for their entire lives. Where every person has access to quality dental care.

Title: Data Manager and Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) and the Corrigan Minehan Heart Center are seeking a highly motivated Clinical Research Data Analyst and Manager interested in helping curate, organize, and analyze large-scale multimodal electronic health record data for ongoing research initiatives. The objectives of the research are to identify individuals at risk for cardiovascular disease. The candidate will work with electronic health record data spanning a research repository containing up to 6 million records. Fields will include those spanning diagnostic, medication, notes, laboratory, electrocardiographic, imaging, and genomic data.
The successful candidate will be highly motivated and eager to learn about cardiovascular disease. Exceptional organizational and interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks are essential. The candidate must be self-motivated, independent in task completion, and comfortable accepting feedback and guidance from colleagues. The candidate should have prior experience with health informatics.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Specific responsibilities will include the following:
Provide clinical data analysis and management support to the investigative team and Principal Investigator.
Curate and organize electronic medical record data from multiple sources and repositories.
Create and maintain longitudinal health record and curated disease-specific datasets.
Perform data analysis against hospital systems to glean meaningful insights and produce actionable reports for team.
Work with research information security and IRB to ensure compliance and adherence to institutional, federal, and other security, regulatory, and compliance policies relating to health data management.
Participate in the development of clinical research documents (eg. Protocols, Case Report Forms, Reports and Statistical Analysis Plans) where relevant.
Develop a Data Management Plan (DMP) for studies, maintain DMP throughout lifecycle of study projects, and ensure DMP is followed according to study design and requirements.
Develop database data specifications, including user requirements, edit rules/checks, query logic and data validations.
Works with investigative team and Principal Investigator to support, maintain and further develop our analytical capabilities which includes but not limited to dashboard and report development, QA of existing reports, and documentation of system functionality.
Work with project manager to ensure data access is provisioned in accordance with protocol approvals.
Assist and provide input into study and project level data analysis plan.
Collaborate with IT and implementation team(s) to address Clinical application requests and/or changes to Clinical database systems.
Participate in team meetings.
Work with coinvestigators, postdoctoral fellows, research analysts, research nurses, and other team members to execute approved protocols.

Qualifications

SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:

High proficiency with computers, specifically the Windows operating system, is essential. Experience with electronic health record curation and analysis is required. Familiarity with accepted electronic health record formats. Working knowledge of relational databases and database structures is key. Experience with cloud computing in Google Cloud or AWS is strongly preferred. Knowledge of REDCap and statistical software, and programming skills in SAS, Python, R, and SQL are strongly preferred.
LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS :

Not applicable
EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree required, master’s degree or doctorate preferred. Coursework in health informatics, computer science, mathematics, biostatistics, epidemiology or related fields preferred..

EXPERIENCE:
 Experience working in an office environment preferred. 2 years of prior research experience is required.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: List the number of FTEs supervised.
 Not applicable

FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY:

Not applicable
WORKING CONDITIONS:

Regular office conditions. Remote office work also possible.

EEO Statement

Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

Title: Data Analyst (Technical Associate I)
FullDescriptions:
Working at MIT offers opportunities, an environment, a culture – and benefits – that just aren’t found together anywhere else. If you’re curious, motivated, want to be part of a unique community, and help shape the future – then take a look at this opportunity.

DATA ANALYST (TECHNICAL ASSOCIATE I), Learning Ecosystems Accelerator for Patient-centered, Sustainable Innovation (LEAPS)-MIT NEW Drug Development ParadIGmS (NEWDIGS) (part-time, 60%), to participate in the design and execution of a research protocol to extract a cohort of patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and subgroups as appropriate. Will tabulate, summarize, and analyze the Massachusetts All-Payers Claims Database (APCD) RA extract to support ongoing research efforts of the LEAPS modelling and simulation team; collaborate on developing appropriate analytical cohorts based on claims continuity and disease stage (e.g., initiation on methotrexate or ongoing therapy); analyze patient clinical and demographic characteristics and the distribution of treatment utilization overall by major payer entity provider-type and over time; determine patterns of utilization by therapy, including duration of therapy, changes in dosage, and treatment holidays; examine prescribing patterns across provider types and geographic distribution and compare with treatment guidelines; and perform other duties assigned.

NEWDIGS is an international “think-and-do-tank” dedicated to delivering more value faster to patients in ways that work for all stakeholders. LEAPS is advancing the mission of MIT NEWDIGS through a new collaborative systems approach to the planning, generation, and use of evidence across R&D and healthcare delivery.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: bachelor’s degree (master’s preferred) in computer science, health care analytics, informatics or similar discipline; at least two years’ experience working with large healthcare data sets; experience with programming (e.g., SAS, Python, R, SQL, Postgres), working with big data, standardizing complex datasets, and data cleaning and transformation; familiarity with basic statistical modelling; documentation skills; attention to detail; good communication skills; experience working with healthcare claims data and cloud-based and serverless application environments; and experience with rheumatoid arthritis or related diseases. Knowledge of the U.S. healthcare system preferred. Job# 17886


Schedule to be determined.


This is a part-time position (60% effort) with the potential to transition into a full-time position based on project needs. It is available to start immediately and is funded through 2020 with the possibility of renewal based on performance and continued project sponsorship.

Qualifications:

FullDescriptions:
Mellon is a specialist multi-asset investment management firm dedicated to serving sophisticated investors globally, providing clients with high-quality single and multi-asset investment solutions using both active and passive strategies. Coming together in 2018 through the combination of Mellon Capital, Standish, and The Boston Company, the combined asset manager has the scale and investment capabilities to offer institutional and intermediary clients a broad range of specialist investment solutions. The Boston Company, Standish, and Mellon Capital are product brands of BNY Mellon Asset Management North America.

The Process and Efficiency Business Analyst is responsible for administering several key processes for Mellon Investment Corporation (Mellon) end to end. These include the production, analysis, and reporting of Assets Under Management (AUM) data; the administration, development, and reporting for Mellon’s implementation of Salesforce.com CRM software: ENGAGE; and data management for the Sales Commissions process for the Business. In addition to this essential role, the Business Analyst will also collaborate with the team on several key functions such as liaising with BNYM Finance, Project initiatives to improve and modernize the three key functions of the role and cross-functional back up on the team.

Responsibilities Include:
Accurately sourcing, quality checking, and maintaining AUM data for Mellon business in its entirety and presenting this data in an acceptable format for use by teams across the firm.
Serves as key point of contact and subject matter expert for CRM software at Mellon.
Serves as the data manager for the Business’s perspective of the Commissions process.
Under moderate guidance, works with internal and external datasets and client reference data and provides analysis.
Provides analytical support and prepares drafts of standard and ad hoc reports for assigned area at the request of managers and/or other leaders.
Presents complex data in a concise and meaningful manner leveraging Excel, BI tools, SQL, data integrity tools, and data presentation tools.
Has a good understanding of the relevant processes and products in assigned area and which analyses, methodologies, and approaches best support assessment of performance, risk, or valuation. Interprets findings and prepares initial drafts of standard reports.
Translates complex technical concepts and analyses to non-technical audiences. Reviews accuracy of reports and calculations performed by less experienced colleagues.
Primarily responsible for the accuracy and quality of own work. Work contributes to the achievement of team goals.
Serves as resource to less experienced colleagues; Provides guidance to more junior analysts.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience
5-7 years’ experience preferred; 5 plus years’ experience in the financial service industry preferred; experience with large and complex financial data sets, problem solving, and attention to detail preferred

Title: Co-op: Data Analyst, Human Biology Lab
Qualifications: Legal authorization to work in the U.S.Grade point average of 3.2 or higher preferredAt least 18 years of age prior to the scheduled start dateBe currently enrolled in an accredited college or university
FullDescriptions:
This role will support the collection and processing of data generated from studies run in the Digital and Quantitative Medicine (DQM) Human Biology Lab. Responsibilities include analysis of time series data from various sensors and/or video to evaluate the ability of new technologies to faithfully extract physiological (e.g. heart rate) and kinematic (e.g. eye movement) signals.
The Digital and Quantitative Medicine (DQM) group within Biogen R&D is built around a scientific paradigm that is designed to enable methods to more accurately quantify health state. Such methods will enable a higher level of refinement and specificity in Biogen’s approach to research. One of the primary responsibilities of DQM is to conduct assessments of clinical measurement technologies. This is achieved by rapidly and iteratively testing new methods in human subjects, and generating, visualizing and interacting with large complex datasets in a highly collaborative environment.

In this role, you will obtain experience working with the Quantitative Biology team within DQM. You will also become familiar with working in a matrixed environment and expand your knowledge of medicine, especially with respect to functional measures in relevant disease and clinical trial design. You will also gain experience with the design and running of clinical research studies as well as Good Clinical Practice procedures.
Qualifications
To participate in the Biogen Co-op Program, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:
Legal authorization to work in the U.S.Grade point average of 3.2 or higher preferredAt least 18 years of age prior to the scheduled start dateBe currently enrolled in an accredited college or university
Additional qualifications:
Completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in science or engineeringDemonstrates a strong ability and drive to identify, analyze and solve problemsFluent with technology solutions including appropriate Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Knowledge and/or interest in the nervous systemKnowledge of Python programming language and data analysis packagesFamiliarity with multimodal wearable sensors and environmental monitors a plusFamiliarity with image processing software such as OpenCV a plus
Education
At least a junior at an undergraduate institution preferably working toward a bachelor’s degree in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Neuroscience, or a related field.

Location
Cambridge, MA

Relocation is not offered for this position.
Employment CategoryFull-Time Regular
Experience Level
Internship or Co-op

You will be part of a team that develops and supports user-friendly analytic reporting tools to enable business partners to make data driven business decisions.

Self-motivated individual with the desire to learn and attack new problems in innovative ways leveraging new and existing technology

The Engineering Data Analyst for SharkNinja will identify and implement changes to existing processes, metrics, and systems in support of optimizing engineering organizational efficiencies to achieve product delivery targets. Working as a member of the Engineering Operations team, the analyst will work closely with global senior leaders and staff to identify actionable metrics, audit points, source data, develop reporting and analytics, and monitor key performance indicators and metrics. The analyst must be a self-starter, an advocate of change, possess strong verbal and written communication skills and be willing to engage functional teams across the global organization.

FullDescriptions:
Company Description
Rated 32nd Most Successful SaaS Company in the world by Montclare, GoodData is on a mission to fundamentally change how analytics are used and adopted throughout the organization. With more than 50 percent of the Fortune 500 using GoodData, millions of end users and a massively scalable and secure Enterprise Insights Platform, GoodData works with customers to drive a business outcome focus allowing data to finally drive meaningful change for the business.
Today, some of the most well-known brands are using the GoodData Enterprise Insights Platform to disrupt their industries, improve productivity and make business-critical decisions, to create revenue-generating Smart Business Applications. According to Forrester, insights-driven businesses will steal $1.2 Trillion/year from traditional market players by 2020. This is the transformation GoodData is enabling globally.
GoodData is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by top-tier investors like Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst Partners, Intel Capital, TOTVS and others. For more information visit our website and follow GoodData on Twitter and LinkedIn.
GoodData is looking for a passionate and proactive Technical Consultant. The ideal candidate will understand the technical challenges across the overall analytics landscape and relish the opportunity to accelerate the evaluation and implementation of GoodData to leading Enterprises and ISVs. The Implementation Consultant's primary responsibility is to partner with the Account Executives and Sr. Sales Engineers to implement GoodData Analytics platform in an efficient and repeatable process using SDKs and APIs to demonstrate the agility, extensibility and scalability of the GoodData platform.

Responsibilities:
Implement existing and develop new automation tools to accelerate delivery of production ready Proof of Concepts.
Develop and maintain API integrations which support a variety of embedded analytics user experiences.
Contribute to and evolve software SDKs and platform automations based on existing development standards and practices.

Desire to grow into a customer focus technical sales person

About GoodData
At GoodData, our mission is to build groundbreaking tools that revolutionize how data drives business. GoodData leads the way in helping companies gain true insights from all of the data available to them, empowering our customers to make faster, smarter actions that deliver better business results.
We are a company built on innovation and dedicated to excellence, but our people are our greatest asset. At GoodData you’re more than part of a team, you’re a member of a family. We seek out innovators who crave an open environment where they can be creative, ambitious and have a real impact. And we work to build a culture where talents can grow, develop and shine.
Our formula for success is the right product and the right people at the right time. How do you fit into our equation?

FullDescriptions:
Senior Business Data Analyst
EF Educational Tours
Boston, MA, United States
Do you have an obsession with numbers and interpreting the stories they tell? As part of EF Education Tour’s MarTech team, you will collaborate with leaders of functional areas in the development of intelligent analyses backed by quantitative data that guide our strategic, tactical and operational business decisions. You will take the lead in defining and implementing standards to tag all digital content in order to improve the quality of generated data. You will proactively and upon request work with identifying trends that suggest new marketing & business opportunities and follow through with the recommendation of key strategies to leverage opportunities. Generate insights and recommendations and present these to the senior management.

Title: Data Analyst
Responsibilities: Works with internal and external customers and Analytics colleagues to understand and document business needs
Requirement:
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in quantitative disciplines (such as biostatistics, statistics, economics, public health, or mathematics) with 1-2 year’s relevant experience in analytics, informatics, or statistics required. 1-2 year work experience may be substituted with a master’s degree in quantitative disciplines in biostatistics, statistics, economics, public health, or mathematics.
Knowledge and skills in statistical methods is required
Proficiency with some statistic software and/or reporting tools is required
Knowledge of relational databases and familiarity with Structured Query Language (SQL) is preferred
Experience in healthcare, insurance industry, or health policy is preferred
FullDescriptions:
At CRICO, a data-driven insurance company, we use medical malpractice claims and other patient safety data through quantitative methods (e.g., multivariate/predictive models) and qualitative approach to identify current and emerging risks. These results and insights are used to inform our internal operational and strategic decisions as well as design of interventions to improve patient safety through partnering with our insured institutions and clients.
We are looking for a person who is a big picture thinker and also detail-oriented. We expect this individual to be innovative and drive continuous improvements in analyzing data and producing insightful reports and models in anticipation of and in reaction to emerging customer needs and CRICO Leadership.
The Data Analyst will have or develop an understanding of patient safety and medical malpractice insurance. He/she will work independently and as part of a team to take an analysis from beginning (problem/question being asked) to end (synthesis and conclusions), including designing the analytic approach by partnering with the requestor, carrying out the analysis, modifying the analysis based on feedback, and presenting findings internally and sometimes externally. In addition to producing analyses, the Data Analyst also needs to coordinate with requesters and/or other involved parties within or across departments to ensure an on-time and quality delivery of an analysis.

Responsibilities
1. Partners with CRICO colleagues (Patient Safety, CRICO Strategies, Claims, Underwriting, Finance), business users (CRICO’s member institutions and non-member clients) to understand business problems, define requirements, develop analytic plan, and execute against it to ensure on-time delivery of results and insights in serving CRICO, CRICO’s members and clients
Works with internal and external customers and Analytics colleagues to understand and document business needs
Follows policies relating to privacy and security, and obtains necessary sign-offs
Queries data and creates data pulls, reports, and graphics in response to regular and ad hoc requests from CRICO’s members and clients
With understanding of objectives and goals of the analysis, synthesizes and interprets data/results effectively and succinctly to make appropriate and relevant conclusions
Tracks and monitors progress on reports and analyses as well as partners with business leads/subject matter experts to manage and deliver results
Validates results before presenting them to the requester
As requested, presents findings to project team, senior management team, or CRICO’s members/clients
2. Develops, maintains, and documents knowledge in risk management, patient safety and loss prevention activities, insurance operations, and reflects understanding back in analytical work
3. Identifies, explores, articulates, and resolves issues surrounding data quality and analytic processes
4. Develops and maintains effective relationships across CRICO departments Patient Safety, Strategies, Finance, Underwriting, and Claims to promote whole-brain thinking and insurance analysis
5. Partners with the IS Department to help optimize data structures and analytic tools as well as to evaluate and recommend analytics tools
6. Researches, stays current, and shares findings and tools with other analytics team members on advancements in the industry and health analytics best practices to support CRICO’s brand as a thought leader
7. Represents the Analytics & Coding Team in internal and external meetings as requested
8. Performs other related duties and ad hoc projects as required

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in quantitative disciplines (such as biostatistics, statistics, economics, public health, or mathematics) with 1-2 year’s relevant experience in analytics, informatics, or statistics required. 1-2 year work experience may be substituted with a master’s degree in quantitative disciplines in biostatistics, statistics, economics, public health, or mathematics.
Knowledge and skills in statistical methods is required
Proficiency with some statistic software and/or reporting tools is required
Knowledge of relational databases and familiarity with Structured Query Language (SQL) is preferred
Experience in healthcare, insurance industry, or health policy is preferred
Project management skill/experience a plus

Title: Data Analyst - Boston, MA
FullDescriptions:
Data Science Team
Nift brings new customers through the doors of neighborhood businesses better than anything else out there. Join the team that’s giving millions of people gifts they love while bringing in the foot traffic that makes neighborhood businesses thrive.
Data Science is the heart and core of our company. Algorithms and models are the foundation upon which our product is built, with data driving our key decisions, testing and growth. Our Chief Scientist, David C Parkes, is the former Area Dean of Computer Science at Harvard, the founder of Harvard’s EconCS Group, and the Co-Director of Harvard's Data Science Initiative. Our data doubles every two months with even more sources waiting to be added. Our product represents a completely new kind of marketplace and the science around it has yet to be defined. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our core team and drive growth and revenue.
This position is based in Boston, MA.
Examples of projects we currently need help with:

Analyze real-time data market economic data
Evaluate experimental results - On simulated data, real-time data and concurrent AB tests.
Collect data, build analysis and present it to monitor and understand the company revenue.
Estimate the demand in multiple local markets (in different sizes, locations and development stages).
Segment customers and businesses; offer insights and identify revenue growth opportunities within existing core verticals and new ones.
Monitor marketplace metrics and system performance and suggest corrective actions when needed.


We have an outstanding core team with deep understanding of algorithmic economics and data science. Our work is highly sought-after and is critical to the success of our business. If you have a proven track-record, want to make an impact and you get excited about the prospects of being part of something really special, we should talk.
Traits we value:

Solid understanding of statistics, economics, and math.
A keen eye for detail and thoughtful investigation of data.
A steadfast focus on creating impactful change and ability to prioritize between many tasks to maximize the improvement of the business.
2+ years of commercial experience is a plus.
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree, a Master’s degree is preferred.
Collaborative team player who values the contribution of others.



We believe it's time technology starts working for Main Street's small businesses. Launched in Boston in the Summer of 2016, our start-up is helping millions of people discover great local businesses.
