1-3 years of experience in image processing, computer vision, statistical or machine learning.
Experience with web technologies including e.g. Node.js (MEAN), Java/Tomcat, Nginx.
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB.

SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Good organizational skills, detail oriented.
Ability to methodically record data and to analyze data using MATLAB, Python, SPSS, UNIX and shell scripts.
Ability to perform a variety of routine tests and prioritize work.
Knowledge of computer programs, databases, etc.
Ability to demonstrate professionalism and respect for data ethics and subjects rights

Technology Statement:
FullDescriptions:
McLean Hospital is a comprehensive psychiatric hospital committed to providing easy access to superior quality, cost-effective mental health services in the Boston area, Massachusetts and beyond. Since 1811, McLean Hospital has been a world leader in the treatment of mental illness and chemical dependency, research into the cause of mental illness and the training of generations of mental health care providers. McLean's multidisciplinary programs treat a broad range of psychiatric illnesses across the full continuum of care.

GENERAL SUMMARY:

Interested in applying technical or computational skills to deep questions about the human mind and mental illness? Have a background in computer science or engineering and want to make an impact on human disease while engaging with intelligent, creative colleagues at the interface of neuroscience, psychiatry, and technology?


Join our team – under the supervision of the Director of Functional Neuroimaging and Bioinformatics for the Psychotic Disorders Division of McLean Hospital and in collaboration with world-class scientists and clinicians at Harvard University, McLean Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital – acquiring and analyzing an array of biological and behavioral data to better understand the causes and cures for severe mental illness, particularly bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.


Data obtained in the lab include (1) structural and functional neuroimaging, (2) physiological measures, (3) eye-tracking, (4) face/body tracking, (5) mobile sensor and usage data, and (6) an array of clinical assessment tools. In addition to refining strategies for longitudinal collection of each of these data types, this position – in collaboration with the Harvard Neuroinformatics Research Group and support technical staff at the Martinos and McLean Imaging Centers – requires maintaining and extending data processing pipelines, maintaining and extending databases for collected data, and assorted technical support services (e.g., basic UNIX support, archiving, troubleshooting). The ideal candidate will have experience with MATLAB, UNIX and shell scripts and ideally experience with analysis of brain imaging data, although not required.


Depending on the interest of the applicant, there are also opportunities for this position to include interaction with patients around study recruitment and performing the procedures listed above.


This position is intended for ambitious, focused individuals looking to launch careers applying technical and computational skills to challenging medical and/or scientific problems, particularly in the neurosciences. Ideal for those transitioning to either graduate school (i.e., MD, PhD, or MD/PhD) or industry but seeking academic experience to develop and apply skills obtained during bachelor’s or masters level work.


All McLean team members are expected to consistently demonstrate our values of integrity, compassion, respect, diversity, teamwork, excellence and innovation in their work activities and interactions.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Responsible for collecting data and maintaining patient information database for study. May be required to input data, do minimum analysis and run various reports. Maintains patients records as part of record keeping function.
Maintain and build software tools to ensure optimal functioning of the lab.
Monitors and sets up any needed equipment.
Maintains inventory and orders supplies when necessary.
Performs all other duties as assigned.
All McLean team members are expected to consistently demonstrate our values of integrity, compassion, respect, diversity, teamwork, excellence and innovation in their work activities and interactions.


Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS:


Required:

BS or BA in computer science, electrical engineering, statistics or related fields
Have strong and demonstrated computer programming skills, including Python.
Have solid experience with computational data analysis, including strong UNIX/Linux skills and experience using high performance computing clusters. Experience with cloud computing platforms is also preferred.
Candidates should have previously participated in research or performed relevant coursework in image processing, computer vision, statistical or machine learning.
Experience with functional MRI is preferred (but not required). Experience with iOS/Android development helpful (but not required)

Preferred
Master degree or equivalent level education in biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, data science or other discipline requiring intense data analysis preferred
1-3 years of experience in image processing, computer vision, statistical or machine learning.
Experience with web technologies including e.g. Node.js (MEAN), Java/Tomcat, Nginx.
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB.

SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Good organizational skills, detail oriented.
Ability to methodically record data and to analyze data using MATLAB, Python, SPSS, UNIX and shell scripts.
Ability to perform a variety of routine tests and prioritize work.
Knowledge of computer programs, databases, etc.
Ability to demonstrate professionalism and respect for data ethics and subjects rights

Technology Statement:
All employees must possess basic computer skills to use a variety of electronic or online systems for communication, clinical and administrative purposes.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:

None

Title: Quality & Patient Safety Senior Data Analyst
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Public Health, etc.
3+ years relevant data analysis experience in healthcare industry
Must have expertise in SQL and data mining techniques to query and manipulate data from multiple sources, and perform data analysis to troubleshoot data integrity issues.
Fluency in SQL server, MySQL or Oracle SQL in support of the utilization of relational databases across DFCI and the ability to independently program in these systems.
Familiarity with best practices for designing and managing relational databases.
Experience with business intelligence tools, such as Tableau, and an understanding of how data structures impact design and development of business intelligence tools.
Must be comfortable documenting business and data requirements, reporting, analytics, and visualization processes.
A strong desire to explore, investigate, dig, and generally uncover patterns and puzzles in data while maintaining a strong sense of thoughtful and pragmatic solutions.
Competent with Microsoft Office suite software (e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio).
Must be detail oriented.
Must be able to function independently in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities.
Must have superior interpersonal and communication skills to effectively work and communicate business logic and data models to different levels of internal and external technical and non-technical staff.
Responsibilities:
Serve as QPS Department’s technical expert in compiling, cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing quality and patient safety data from multiple data sources to support various stakeholders.
Identify and integrate disparate data sources, both internal and external, including raw and unstructured data from technical and non-technical teams.
Utilize business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, etc.) to create reports and dashboards.
Document data and build requirements according to standard practice.
Ensure that deliverables are of highest quality.
Support analytics capacity building activities.
Collaborate with QPS Department stakeholders, Clinical Operations and Business Analytics (COBA) team members, DFCI data owners, and data warehousing partners to prioritize and generate robust data sources to serve as institutional sources of truth on key quality and patient safety metrics.
Immediately bring to the attention of the COBA Lead and Quality Analytics Program Manager issues, concerns and problems which may hinder achievement of deadlines and or/ accomplishments of responsibilities.
Perform other similar and related duties as required or directed.
FullDescriptions:
Overview
Located in Boston and the surrounding communities, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute brings together world renowned clinicians, innovative researchers and dedicated professionals, allies in the common mission of conquering cancer, HIV/AIDS and related diseases. Combining extremely talented people with the best technologies in a genuinely positive environment, we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients of all ages; we conduct research that advances treatment; we educate tomorrow's physician/researchers; we reach out to underserved members of our community; and we work with amazing partners, including other Harvard Medical School-affiliated hospitals.

The Clinical Operations and Business Analytics (COBA) team is part of the strategic initiative at DFCI to enable the transformation of data into insights and actionable information to the different operational, clinical, and business departments across the institute. In pursuit of these goals, the COBA team is seeking to hire a Senior Data Analyst to support the growing analytics capability of Quality & Patient Safety (QPS) Department at DFCI. DFCI’s Quality & Patient Safety (QPS) Department relies heavily on data to generate reports to internal committees and external regulatory bodies, measure the success of institution-wide quality improvement initiatives, and produce quality and safety-related insights. The QPS Senior Data Analyst (SDA) will support the aforementioned data needs of the department and the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement (QAPI) plan. DFCI’s QAPI plan defines expectations for use of objective measures to monitor and improve the quality of services provided to DFCI patients. These measures are calculated from a multitude of sources and reported on a quarterly basis. The SDA will work with various stakeholders to understand these data sources and work to streamline DFCI’s QAPI metrics into an automated online dashboard.
Responsibilities
The QPS SDA must develop an in-depth understanding of DFCI’s wide range of data sources and data structures as well as the ability to translate quality and safety-related business specifications into data models that enable reporting and new insights. In addition, the QPS SDA must have excellent communication skills and ability to engage and educate the analytic community on how to leverage the variety of data sources. The QPS SDA will be expected to work in a team as well as independently within a fast-paced environment, work on several different projects/tasks concurrently and serve as a data advisor to projects related to quality and patient safety. Assignments will include data engineering, validation, documentation and management. The QPS SDA will work with a variety of tools (ex: SQL, Tableau, Excel, etc.) to access data, write queries, develop programming logic, run reports, manipulate, and analyze large datasets to meet the needs of the QPS Department. The Mission, Vision, and Core Values of the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute are incorporated into all areas of practice.

Serve as QPS Department’s technical expert in compiling, cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing quality and patient safety data from multiple data sources to support various stakeholders.
Identify and integrate disparate data sources, both internal and external, including raw and unstructured data from technical and non-technical teams.
Utilize business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, etc.) to create reports and dashboards.
Document data and build requirements according to standard practice.
Ensure that deliverables are of highest quality.
Support analytics capacity building activities.
Collaborate with QPS Department stakeholders, Clinical Operations and Business Analytics (COBA) team members, DFCI data owners, and data warehousing partners to prioritize and generate robust data sources to serve as institutional sources of truth on key quality and patient safety metrics.
Immediately bring to the attention of the COBA Lead and Quality Analytics Program Manager issues, concerns and problems which may hinder achievement of deadlines and or/ accomplishments of responsibilities.
Perform other similar and related duties as required or directed.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Public Health, etc.
3+ years relevant data analysis experience in healthcare industry
Must have expertise in SQL and data mining techniques to query and manipulate data from multiple sources, and perform data analysis to troubleshoot data integrity issues.
Fluency in SQL server, MySQL or Oracle SQL in support of the utilization of relational databases across DFCI and the ability to independently program in these systems.
Familiarity with best practices for designing and managing relational databases.
Experience with business intelligence tools, such as Tableau, and an understanding of how data structures impact design and development of business intelligence tools.
Must be comfortable documenting business and data requirements, reporting, analytics, and visualization processes.
A strong desire to explore, investigate, dig, and generally uncover patterns and puzzles in data while maintaining a strong sense of thoughtful and pragmatic solutions.
Competent with Microsoft Office suite software (e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio).
Must be detail oriented.
Must be able to function independently in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities.
Must have superior interpersonal and communication skills to effectively work and communicate business logic and data models to different levels of internal and external technical and non-technical staff.
Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is an equal opportunity employer and affirms the right of every qualified applicant to receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, ancestry, military service, protected veteran status, or other groups as protected by law.

Title: IT Internship Program | Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Success is always in style at TJX, a Fortune 100 company and the leading off-price apparel and home fashion retailer in the U.S. and worldwide. Our retail chains include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense and T.K. Maxx.

Ready to make your impact on the way technology enables our retail business and our bottom line? Then you’re ready to Discover Different. During this internship, you’ll learn about retail from the inside out, and build a thorough understanding of how technology is key to driving results across every area of our business.

IT Business Analyst Basics: Delivering Better Solutions—On A Global Scale.
We collaborate and provide the technology expertise and support to all aspects of our business including Home Office, Stores, Distribution Centers and Buying Offices. Our mission is to continuously explore, identify, and deliver competitive advantaged solutions through our people, partners, processes, and technology to enable the successful execution of our off-price retail model.
Our team works with legacy and emerging technologies while partnering with a global team of experienced technology professionals and leaders. Our IT team encourages new ideas and applications of technology in support of our business, while also focusing and fostering career development through a variety of projects, experiences and opportunities throughout our Global IT organization.
The Opportunity: Support Our Global IT Initiatives—And Our Business Model.
Global IT at TJX is offering internship opportunities at our Marlborough or Framingham, MA offices to students seeking to learn, grow, and contribute in a fast-paced, dynamic global IT organization. You will gain industry experience in retail technology and have opportunities to work in an Agile environment and contribute to strategic projects that will enable the development of innovation solutions to make our platforms even better.

Multiple Summer 2020 internship opportunities are available as an IT Business Analyst Intern within a variety of areas within the TJX Global IT organization such as:

/ Solution Delivery
/ IT Security & Compliance
/ Infrastructure & Operations
These internships will provide business and project analytical support for critical global IT initiatives, enabling the TJX retail business operating model. Every day, you’ll discover what makes being at TJX so different—working on projects that contribute to the IT transformation strategy, as well as assisting with daily activities within the IT functions. You will collaborate with experienced technical experts and strategists, to ensure we are managing and executing assigned projects and deliverables in a timely, effective, and efficient manner.

Responsibilities may include:
/ Supporting the execution of key deliverables on IT roadmap

/ Tool evaluation and recommendations through proof of concepts

/ Supporting of resource planning and budget

/ Reviewing and evolving current processes (e.g. Visio process flows)

/ Effective project communication and updates

/ Team meeting support

/ Technical documentation

Each IT Business Analyst Intern will receive targeted supervision and guidance, hands-on training to facilitate learning, while given a high degree of creativity and autonomy—providing the tools for success in a global Fortune 100 retail technology environment.

Who We Are Looking For: It Just Might Be You.
We are looking for students who are highly motivated self-starters and who possess the ability to prioritize effectively, be proactive and flexible, and thrives in a fast-paced, professional environment. Additional skills include:
/ A genuine interest in technology solutions and innovation
/ Experience working with numbers
/ Problem solvers who can think creatively
/ Excellent communicator
/ Students with proven leadership abilities and strong work ethic
/ Those who can think in “Agile Mindset”—flexible, change adept, willingness to learn
/ Knowledge, understanding, and experience with: MS Visio, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Word
/ Knowledge of Tableau and/or Power BI software
Key Qualifications:
/ A well-founded academic background – GPA of 3.0 or above
/ Students eligible for an intermediate or advanced internship
/ Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or related major (other majors may be considered)

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Post Internship: We’ve Got Big Plans For You.
High performing Interns may be offered one of multiple opportunities upon successful completion of their intern experience:
/ Return for a second Corporate IT Internship opportunity
/ Join us in a full-time Corporate IT role after graduation

Reliable transportation is required as TJX is not easily accessible to public transportation.
TJX is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.

At TJX, we are proud that, for 40 years, we have been providing amazing value to our customers, but the merchandise we sell is just part of our story. We believe our Associates bring our business to life, and we aim to support you by making TJX a terrific place to work. We are committed to leveraging our differences, and believe that the diverse skills, experiences and background that you bring into the organization will help us continue to succeed.
Discover Different. Apply today!

In addition to our open door policy and supportive work environment, we also strive to provide a competitive salary and benefits package. TJX considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status, or based on any individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. TJX also provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.
Posting Notes: Marlborough || MA

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Data Analyst
The Boston (Charlestown) office of MARC USA / Cogniscient Media is hiring a progressive Data Analytics pro, with a Digital Media focus. Our Data Analysts work with agency and client teams to plan, measure, and optimize digital media campaigns. Analysts help to develop strategic measurement and testing plans, design and manage performance reports and dashboards, and help clients translate raw data into meaningful insights and recommendations. This individual should have strong attention to detail, excellent communication and presentation skills, and experience analyzing and modeling data from a variety of sources.

Your Role – What You'll Be Doing:
Help develop campaign measurement strategies for clients across a wide range of industries
Extract, transform, load and blend data from multiple sources, while maintaining strict standards for data quality and accuracy
Utilize a variety of web analytics, data management and business intelligence tools (Google Analytics, DART, SQL, Power BI, Excel, etc.)
Design, develop and maintain client-facing reports and dashboards to visualize key patterns and trends
Collaborate with cross-agency teams to develop data-driven insights and recommendations, optimize media performance, and identify opportunities to deliver added value and enhance client relationships
Develop and execute test designs and ad hoc analyses
Develop and present findings to clients and senior-level stakeholders
To excel in this role, you should have the following:
Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Math, Statistics, Economics, Data Analytics or a related field
1-2 years of data analytics experience required

Title: Data Analyst
Senior Data Analyst- Physician Payment
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in related field is required.
Masters in Healthcare Administration or Public Health preferred.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in related field is required.
Masters in Healthcare Administration or Public Health preferred.
FullDescriptions:
Reporting to the Director of Physician Analytics for the MGPO/BWPO, the Analyst II provides advanced analytics to support contract proposals with third party payers/government payers; develops financial models to support physician negotiations and rate implementation; works independently to design and create databases and develop data reporting systems; and researches physician reimbursement and policy issues. Other specific responsibilities include the following:

Collect, analyze and model financial data to forecast impact of payer proposals and yearly fee updates on physician revenues.
Review and analyze PHS risk contracts, including Medicare’s RVU data, to determine adequacy of negotiated target.
Manage projects as it relates to the coordination of data and information across the POs, hospitals, PHS, and/or the physician practices. Represent the project to senior leadership and physician councils.
Provide comparative payer data to physician groups to aid in decision making processes regarding rates and contracts.
Research Medicare, Medicaid and other payer reimbursement issues, including new technologies and procedures. Research new opportunities for participation in Medicare Pilots such as bundles, etc. Report the findings of such research, including positive and negative impact to physician payment and reimbursement, as well as proposed solutions.
Support PHS Contracting in the development of system-wide contract strategies.
Work on special projects as assigned.

Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in related field is required.
Masters in Healthcare Administration or Public Health preferred.


 Experience:

Minimum 3-5 years healthcare/analytic experience.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple responsibilities in complex environment.
Working knowledge of physician reimbursement, medical terminology, ICD 10, CPT and HCPCS coding preferred.
Payer experience a plus
Superior quantitative analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong organizational and project management skills with attention to detail to manage multiple projects under aggressive deadlines.
Expertise in managing, interpreting, reporting and presenting data to all levels of management.
Must be self-directed and self-motivated. Able to work independently and as a part of a team.
Able to respond to changing situations and manage time appropriately to meet deadlines.
Thorough understanding of RBRVS payment methodology in conjunction with other physician payment systems preferred.
Proficiency in Access or other relational databases required. Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and Word also desired.
Experience with designing advanced data visualizations, and some familiarity with visualization software (e.g. QlikView or Tableau)
Good research skills.
Business Intelligence Software experience preferred.

Title: Associate Ecommerce Analyst
FullDescriptions:
About Us

Teikametrics is the leading Retail Optimization Platform (ROP) for sellers on Amazon. Teikametrics optimizes billions of transactions for thousands of sellers, brands and agencies around the world to increase overall sales and profits. Founded in 2012, Teikametrics uses proprietary econometrics and machine-learning data models to automate bidding and campaign management of Amazon Advertising. We combine our best in class technology with world-class service delivery teams all based in Boston, MA.

Teikametrics is looking for a passionate, smart and driven Associate Ecommerce Analyst to help Sellers and Brands win on Amazon with data. This role will work directly with business owners and start up brands to understand their Amazon advertising goals, develop winning strategies and execute them through Teikametrics software. The Associate Ecommerce Analyst will exclusively pursue customer objectives and build meaningful client relationships to maximize client satisfaction, growth, and retention.

Responsibilities


Execute Amazon Advertising Campaigns: Manage campaign creation and Amazon advertising investment for multiple direct-response ad types across a portfolio of ~10-20 clients. Deliver consistent quarter-on-quarter growth in client advertising performance and investment.
Build Meaningful Client Relationships: Structure weekly client engagement and create meaningful analyses and reports to support clients business goals. Develop strong relationships with all clients.
Drive Client Strategy from Data: Source and analyze data through the use of tools such as Sigma and Excel to provide services as needed. Develop insights into brand performance that are not readily evident.
Become an Expert in Amazon Advertising, eCommerce and Direct Marketing: Stay apace with new direct marketing innovations coming out of Amazon and guide clients through adoption.

Requirements


Bachelor’s degree from top tier university - ideally with a concentration in Economics, Marketing, Finance, Business Administration, Commerce, Mathematics, or Communications.
0-3 years of experience as a client-analyst for a retail-oriented software or services company. This can include a background directly at an eCommerce business, an advertising technology company, or direct-marketing services agency.
Strong quantitative skills, a passion for data analysis and familiarity with Excel. Expressed interest in continuing education in new tools and skills like Snowflake, SQL, and others.
Excellent communication skills with deep proficiency in professional writing and presentation.

What you’ll get


Competitive salary & benefits
Flexible working hours and conditions
A supportive and challenging environment to learn in
A five minute walk from South Station in Boston
Fully stocked kitchen with coffee/tea, beer, and healthy snacks
An amazing opportunity to join one of the top growing companies in Boston

Title: Automotive Data Entry Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Data Analyst position is a key contributor to our automotive data products. You will be part of a collaborative team of Data Analysts that work together, and independently, to create the core datasets that power DataOne's products. The contributions of the Data Analyst's position are focused on acquiring automotive data, analyzing and interpreting that data, and finally incorporating it into DataOne's proprietary dataset set using a suite of internal tools. This is a great opportunity to join a fast growing and profitable small business that develops its employees and promotes from within.
Additional details below:
The core job responsibilities of our Data Analysts will be to obtain, compile, analyze, interpret, research and enter data needed by DataOne Software from the Automotive Industry.
Extensive training will be provided on both the automotive space and the technology you will utilize in your role
Data Analysts will gain a high level of knowledge and expertise of automotive vehicles and their manufacturers.
This expertise will be used to interpret, analyze and incorporate the desired data into our normalized database.
Successful Data Analysts perform their duties with a high level of consistency, accuracy, and attention to details.
As a member of our Automotive Data Team, Data Analysts will contribute to the achievement of team and individual goals.
Data Analysts will have the opportunity to work on special projects commensurate with their abilities, experience and skill level.
Analysts will work with Customer Support to investigate and resolve any reports of errors related to their work.
The position activity breaks down into roughly the following general activities:
40% data analysis
35% data entry
15% data acquisition
10% special projects
Required Skills:
Upon Hire
Strong research, analytical, math, and problem-solving abilities are necessary to be successful
Strong computer skills, OR strong knowledge of and experience with the automotive industry/data
Very high accuracy and attention to details required and must be demonstrated in decision making and entry of information.
Typing speed of 30+ accurate words per minute
Proficient with Gmail, Google Docs, Microsoft Word and Excel.
Be willing to be trained on, and have the ability to pick up, new technology skills
Acquired post-hire
Excellent understanding of the Automotive industry including Automotive brands, manufacturers, technology/equipment, vehicle types, market segments, specifications.
Education/Experience
High School degree is mandatory. Associates degree or higher desired.
Would prefer 1-3 years of experience in the data entry field to acquire skills necessary to coordinate and perform a variety of data entry and data collection activities.
Required Attributes
Positive approach
Team player
Creative problem solver
Accurate and detail oriented
Focused
Motivated
Professional
Good time management
About DE
Dominion Enterprises (DE) is a leading digital marketing and software services company offering client solutions across multiple business verticals. Our customers rely on our B2B cloud SaaS solutions to establish their online and mobile brands, generate leads, and manage customer relationships through our Homes.com, Dominion Dealer Solutions, Dominion Business Solutions / DX1, Travel Media and Franchise and Business Opportunity divisions. Our B2C web and mobile applications include Homes.com, HotelCoupons.com, FranchiseOpportunities.com, FranchiseGator.com, Franchise.com, and BusinessBroker.net.
About 2,000 employees reside and work in our Norfolk, VA home office and in offices across the U.S.Â Our employees will tell you about our collaborative, innovative, team-oriented work environment, excellent career enrichment opportunities, community service opportunities, competitive earnings, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a generous 401(k). DE is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse workforce. DE is a drug-testing employer.

Title: Junior Social Media Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
About Brandwatch
Brandwatch is the world’s pioneering digital consumer intelligence suite, helping over 2,000 of the world’s most admired brands and agencies including Unilever, Walmart and Dell to make insightful, data-driven business decisions.
The company has made three acquisitions to date: PeerIndex (2013), BuzzSumo (2017) as a standalone content marketing platform, and Qriously (2019) to add global survey capabilities. Additionally, the company was bolstered by its merger with Crimson Hexagon (2018) to create the most comprehensive AI-powered social intelligence solution.
Brandwatch has offices around the globe including Brighton, Boston, New York, London, Berlin, Stuttgart, Paris, Madrid, Sydney and Singapore.
Your role will include:

Professional Services is a core component of Customer Success at Brandwatch. As a team, we strive to enable and advance our clients’ use of social data across their organizations by taking them from data, to insights, to actions that have a real business impact and empower our users’ long-term self-sufficiency.As we continue our global expansion, we are hiring a customer-focused Junior Social Media Analyst to join our dynamic Professional Services team in Brighton. This is an exciting opportunity that offers hands-on work and the flexibility to learn, grow, and develop in the constantly changing landscape of social intelligence.

We’re looking for someone who:

Loves using data to answer questions
Solves problems for fun and enjoys testing limits
Has a keen eye for detail
Thrives on helping people
Can present technical concepts in business-friendly and user-friendly language
Wants to work with a wide variety of brands and use-cases
Prefers a hands-on, forward-thinking approach
Is comfortable working independently in a deadline-driven environment
In this role, you will:
Become a proficient user and advocate of the Brandwatch product suite
Implement effective social media measurement solutions on behalf of Brandwatch clients
Collaborate with senior colleagues to execute large, complex or novel solutions
Perform quality assurance on the work of 3rd party contributors to identify and correct data quality or validity issues
Attend client meetings as a subject-matter specialist, and represent your own work in a clear, engaging manner
Coordinate scheduling with our top-class Project Management team
Provide feedback to guide new product development
You should have:
6+ months experience working independently in an office environment (or similar)
Strong time-management and task-management skills
Computer literacy, including experience with Microsoft/Google suites (spreadsheets, presentations, documents) and familiarity with social media platforms
A degree in an analytical or business-related subject (such as marketing/market research, data analytics, business analytics, linguistics, natural sciences, computer science, engineering, economics, maths, statistics, etc.), or equivalent experience
Ability to accommodate occasional domestic and international travel
Authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship

Icing on the cake:

Familiarity with social media data, social analytics platforms, or unstructured text data
Familiarity with basic statistical concepts (distributions, significance, sampling)
Fluency in another language (or two!) would be a bonus
What we offer:
Benefits: We offer a customizable set of benefits, including health/dental/vision coverage, 401K/retirement funds, generous paid vacation, and commuter benefits.
Culture: Brandwatch is a place where the lines between work and fun are blurred. As a growing international company, with 10 offices across the globe, communication is key to ensure everyone’s voices are heard, and helps us maintain our flat structure. We listen and learn. We develop our staff. We care about everything, and above all we support each other.
Working for Brandwatch: Brandwatch in Boston operates with the highest level of integrity and keep our code of ethics in mind for everything that we do. Our light-filled office has a kitchen bursting with snacks, fresh fruit, and fridge stocked with drinks and, of course, coffee.
To all recruitment agencies: Brandwatch does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias or Brandwatch employees. Brandwatch is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Who We Are Looking For
At ButcherBox, we use data to drive our decisions — we’re not best guess type of people - and our data analysts are critical in sketching out the narrative for these decisions. We’re accountable, we love collaboration, and challenges keep us coming to work. Our team at ButcherBox believes in better — from the product we’re delivering to the partners we source from to the modern data estate we’re building.

We want data enthusiasts on our team who can join us in our journey to delight our members by offering an unparalleled experience when they shop with us. By working across the company with key stakeholders, we promise you’ll gain exposure to all aspects of our companies. Who knows, you might even earn an honorary PhD in meat. We’re committed to crafting spaces where people with varied opinions, experiences and perspectives thrive.

What You'll Do


Partner with all departments to develop a solid understanding of our business, and ultimately provide recommendations on core metrics and data analysis to improve their departments
Analyze various data to continue painting a picture of who are members are and influential patterns to craft and present compelling stories of data centric analysis
Develop an understanding growth drivers and opportunities for business optimization
Analyze in-depth paid marketing channel performance across paid search, paid social media, display, SEO & more to advise team on patterns and relationships in the data to recommend campaign strategies
Be a data champion across the organization

Who You Are


2+ years of relevant work experience in data analysis
Experience with a cloud big data analytics platform
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills
Proficiency in R or Python
Intermediate SQL ability
Experience or ability to learn BI tool reporting
Attention to detail and stellar communication skills
Able to work well in both an independent and team environment

Bonus Points


Experience with Microsoft Azure, Databricks, PowerBI
Experience in consumer products, ecommerce, subscription model businesses

Benefits


A very supportive team, a culture of "do your job" autonomy, and access to all levels of the organization
Health insurance (including medical, dental, vision)
401(k) with generous employer match
Employee stock options
Subsidized commuter benefits
Unlimited time off policy
Professional development opportunities
Free box of meat each month
Free gym membership

Who We Are
ButcherBox is a fast-paced, rapidly growing company headquartered in Brighton, MA. We work to connect people with the food they want to eat. While we began by only providing 100% grass-fed and grass-finished beef to our members, we have since expanded our offerings to include free-range organic chicken, heritage-breed pork, wild-caught Alaskan sockeye salmon and more.

We believe in a healthier food system where everyone has access to meat the way Nature intended: from animals that are humanely raised and never given any antibiotics or added hormones. ButcherBox exists to ensure that access to high-quality meat you can trust is convenient. We provide better meat for a better you.

Our team is made up of people who collaborate and support one another. We’re always looking for amazing people to join our mission!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst- Blink
FullDescriptions:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field5+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role3+ year of experience conducting analysis using Excel

Blink was the result of one of the most successful crowdfunding campaigns ever and is now part of Amazon Devices, the consumer electronics division that brings you the Kindle, Fire Tablets, Fire TV, and Echos. Our mission is to provide peace of mind for home owners while they are way from home using our wire-free, battery-operated smart home security cameras.

Are you interested in being part of a high visibility, strategic team that directly impacts the Blink business worldwide? We are looking for motivated self-starters that can work in a fast paced environment. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for data-driven decision-making.

We need someone who can deep dive sales financial and market data to derive actionable insights, find savings opportunities, and identify areas for growth. Our ideal candidate has the ability to work fluidly between marketing, financial and sales teams, and is strong in translating data into digestible information that facilitates Blink’s decision making and strategy.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities and business acumen, with exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of business financials and the underlying analytics, with the ability to identify new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, vocally self-critical, and an ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. They will analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems and build metrics that help Blink management make critical decisions.

Responsibilities

Title: ASSISTANT DATA ANALYST, School of Medicine, Anatomy & Neurobiology
FullDescriptions:
Since our beginning in 1948, the Framingham Heart Study, under the direction of the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI), formerly known as the National Heart Institute, has been committed to identifying the common factors or characteristics that contribute to cardiovascular disease (CVD). We have followed CVD development over a long period of time in three generations of participants. Over the years, careful monitoring of the Framingham Study population has led to the identification of major CVD risk factors, as well as valuable information on the effects of these factors such as blood pressure, blood triglyceride and cholesterol levels, age, gender, and psychosocial issues. Risk factors for other physiological conditions such as dementia have been and continue to be investigated. In addition, the relationships between physical traits and genetic patterns are being studied.

The current positon is with the Neuropsychology group at the Framingham Heart Study. Our goals are to identify and research factors associated with brain health. Much of our work is centered around the different forms of dementia that develop throughout the lifespan. We routinely give neuropsychological tests to our participants to determine behavioral biomarkers associated with cognitive decline. Our data collection techniques include both conventional measurements and digital unstructured data. We are seeking a data analyst, who is interested in working full-time with our data analytic team. The ideal candidate should have at least a Bachelor's degree in health science or public health with a proven track record of academic excellence and is proficient in statistical computer languages (preferably R or SAS). They must be comfortable working with large database to mine and data curate custom datasets. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams (both within and outside of Boston University). This entry-level position is a great fit for someone pursuing a career in statistics and/or big data analytics.

Required Skills
Bachelor's degree required; Master's preferred. 1-3 years of work experience required.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Required Experience

Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
ABOUT HOPPER

At Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app - one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.

Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015.

Take off with us!

Hopper was built on the premise that the combination of big data and machine learning could make a difference. At Hopper, every dataset tells a story. Do you have what it takes to decipher the clues? bit.ly/2q6U8dq

We’re looking for a data-savvy individual to join our Data Science team as a Data Analyst. They will help create consumer-focused research, as well as a user-centric product development and growth based on our real-time along with an archive of several trillion data points. If you are interested in this topic, you may be interested in the subject of data gathering and finding effective ways to simplify and communicate to a non-technical audience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Lead analytical projects to support our Product and Growth teams. Deliver quantitative results, business understanding and strategic insights to help make better data-driven decisions.
Support our PR team by transforming complex information analyzes into short, compelling, and easy to understand studies.
Design and implement ad hoc and automated analysis scripts, develop and deliver your tables, charts and interactive tools to present your results.
Work with key stakeholders across a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

A QUALIFIED CANDIDATE HAS:

A degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative discipline
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Proven ability to communicate complex technical work to a non-technical audience
Enthusiasm and curiosity for conducting research and answering hard questions with data
Exposure to scripting with Pandas, R, SAS or other data preparation and analysis tools
Experience with relational databases and SQL would be an asset
BENEFITS

Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options
Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business
100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans
Access to a 401k (Boston) or Retirement Savings Plan (Montreal)
Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass
IATA Travel Agent Card for discounts in the travel industry
Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy)
In Cambridge, work in a historic factory building near Kendall Square; in Montreal, work in an artist’s loft in the Mile End
Team lunches, offsite activities and much more!

Title: Data Analyst I - 40 Hours / Day / BWH Channing
FullDescriptions:
The Channing Division of Network Medicine at Brigham and Women's Hospital is looking for an exceptional data analyst candidate to join the Systems Genetics and Genomics group as part of a team researching chronic respiratory disease, particularly Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), the leading cause of respiratory mortality in the United States.

Our group has led some of the largest and most comprehensive genetic and multi-omic studies in this disease, including identifying novel genetic associations and performing functional studies to identify new disease pathways. Data analysts will work as part of an interdisciplinary team, consisting of geneticists and genetic epidemiologists, biostatisticians, computational biologists, and translational scientists and clinicians, including biostatistics faculty at the Harvard School of Public Health. The analyst will work on one of several R01 funded projects performing dataset quality control, management, and analysis of large-scale whole-genome sequencing data; transcriptome and epigenome data; and integrative analysis.
The candidate will work directly with Dr. Michael Cho, in collaboration with Dr. Edwin Silverman, Professor of Medicine and Harvard Medical School and Brigham and Women's Hospital, and Chief of the Division of Network Medicine.

Qualifications

Qualified candidates a Masters' degree in bioinformatics, statistics, mathematics, physics, or a related quantitative field, and strong programming skills in R / Bioconductor, Python, or MATLAB is preferred. A minimum of 1 year direct experience is required.
Previous experience in analysis of genetic or other -omic data is highly desirable.

EEO Statement

Brigham and Women's Hospital is a Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Title: Research Technician II with bioinformatics experience or data analyst
FullDescriptions:
A Research Technician II or data analyst position is available in the Nahrendorf and Naxerova laboratories at the Center for Systems Biology at Massachusetts General Hospital and Harvard Medical School.

If you are a motivated scientist with a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computational biology, bioinformatics, statistics or related relevant fields, and you want to be part of a dynamic, friendly team that produces and analyzes a large amount of complex data (genotyping data, DNA and RNA sequencing data, single cell sequencing data), please consider applying!

We have a multitude of interesting projects in cancer genetics and cardiovascular disease research that will provide a rich playing ground for a person who enjoys thinking about data and its (biological) implications. We are looking for somebody who will actively be engaged in the research and take responsibility for their projects. This is not a job in which you will be told what to do step by step. After a thorough training phase, you will work independently and be able to realize your own ideas. You will be embedded into a great research team with lots of support, both from the biological as well as from the bioinformatics side.

Recent graduates who are looking to earn a few years of research experience before applying to graduate school are particularly welcome.

Please review these websites to learn more about our research:

https://csb.mgh.harvard.edu/naxerova
https://csb.mgh.harvard.edu/nahrendorf

FullDescriptions:
Job CodeI0858P IT Business Analysis Prfss IV
Job-Specific Responsibilities
The FAS Office of Finance is a dynamic work environment that conducts strategic and financial analysis, as well as other projects, to inform resource allocation and decision making for Academic Leadership and other Senior Management. The Senior Business Systems and Data Analyst will be responsible for the development of new tools and techniques to support enhanced financial planning strategies and the development of new adaptations of current budget processes that target better use of restricted resources and more informed resource planning approaches.

The Senior Business Systems and Data Analyst will play a vital role in managing data and information systems for a high-volume, data-driven office.

Primary responsibilities include:

Analytical Design and Financial Modeling
Design and build analytical tools that enhance multi-year planning, planning initiatives, annual budget and forecast, and budget-to-actual monitoring.
Recommend, design and create new models and methods that will improve data accuracy, provide consistent reporting and deliver information more efficiently.
Revise current budget tools to target better use of restricted resources and more informed resource planning approaches.
Provide accurate and timely analytical support for budget and planning team.
Data Management and Report Development
Develop and produce materials to facilitate annual budget planning, which includes enhancing, producing and distributing unit-specific planning workbooks using Microsoft Excel and VBA/Macros.
Review budget data and explore options for report development within the University budget application (HUBS) for departments/units.
Build new tools for financial monitoring of budget-to-actuals at the school and department/unit level.
Gather business requirements for data and reporting needs. Translate business requirements into reports and analyses. Develop various financial reporting packages that support senior leadership in decision making.
Develop technical solutions for complex business processes and for information needs. Technical solutions may include (a) writing ad hoc SQL queries and Oracle PL/SQL code to produce complex reports in an Oracle database environment and (b) developing reports and dashboards in Tableau.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by reconciling data discrepancies between different data sources.
The Senior Business Systems and Data Analyst reports to the Associate Director for Budget and Planning Analysis in the FAS Office of Finance.

Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business needs into systems requirements and scoping

Responsible for business transition management to ensure that systems are understood by users

Advise unit/school

Strong problem solving, organizational, analytical, data analysis, and facilitation skills.
Proven ability to work in a complex environment and take an assignment from project design to final presentation with a minimum of supervision is necessary.
Advanced desktop application skills including Excel (including VBA/Macros), Word, MS Project, Access, PowerPoint, and Visio. Experience accessing and merging data from multiple internal systems to perform analytics.

Title: Operations Analyst, Digital Health Innovation
Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in Healthcare Administration or Business Management.2 - 3 years of experience in business operations or business analyst role.Healthcare experience preferred, especially at an academic medical facility or healthcare focused technology company.Ability to understand and learn new technology.High proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Skills: Clear written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work independently and as a team member.Ability to prioritize workload according to service pressures.Fundamental understanding of project and financial management processes.Excellent knowledge of SharePoint and Microsoft Office Suite.
Responsibilities: Research and analysis of digital health vendors, products, and trends.Delivery of concise reports in the form of written documents, tables, dashboards, and PowerPoint decks.Analysis and documentation of workflows spanning all areas of patient and provider experience.Financial analysis and development of ROI and business plans as necessary, supporting translational scaling of innovation pilots across the organization.Assistance with governance processes, meetings, and documentation.Documentation of DHI processes, decisions, metrics and reference materials.Collaborate with Partners stakeholders spanning clinical, business, and Enterprise Data and Digital Health to define digital innovation needs and impact on DHI processes.
FullDescriptions:
About Us:

As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

General Summary/Overview Statement
Partners Healthcare is working to build the next generation of healthcare by investing in digital solutions, analytics, and big data. As part of this initiative, we are forming the Digital Health Innovation (DHI) team, with the charter to support and encourage digital innovation across Partners Healthcare by partnering with innovative internal and external stakeholders to find solutions to healthcare’s most pressing problems. The DHI team will be composed of a talented group of analyst, project managers, and technical subject matter experts who will work hand in hand with innovators at Partners’ academic medical centers (Brigham Women’s and Mass General), community hospitals, and start-ups to launch pilots of digital products, build core infrastructure to support innovation, and forge partnerships.
The Operations Analyst will be a key resource within DHI, with responsibility of managing day-to-day operations for the DHI group as well as project analysis and assistance, financial management, and vendor management and analysis. The Operations Analyst reports directly to the Innovation Manager as a key contributor in the delivery of DHI’s mission.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Working under the general direction of the Innovation Manager, the Operations Analyst will work closely with the DHI team and Innovation Manager to run daily operations, define workflows and processes, track and report on project and performance KPIs, and improve performance and efficiency in pilot programs and projects. The Operations analyst should be an effective data analyst and possess the ability to effectively communicate with employees at all levels. The Operations Analyst is responsible for a variety of duties in a fast-paced, dynamic environment involving project intake and analysis.

Responsibilities:
Research and analysis of digital health vendors, products, and trends.Delivery of concise reports in the form of written documents, tables, dashboards, and PowerPoint decks.Analysis and documentation of workflows spanning all areas of patient and provider experience.Financial analysis and development of ROI and business plans as necessary, supporting translational scaling of innovation pilots across the organization.Assistance with governance processes, meetings, and documentation.Documentation of DHI processes, decisions, metrics and reference materials.Collaborate with Partners stakeholders spanning clinical, business, and Enterprise Data and Digital Health to define digital innovation needs and impact on DHI processes.


Qualifications

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in Healthcare Administration or Business Management.2 - 3 years of experience in business operations or business analyst role.Healthcare experience preferred, especially at an academic medical facility or healthcare focused technology company.Ability to understand and learn new technology.High proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

Skills/Abilities/Competencies
Key Competencies
Clear written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work independently and as a team member.Ability to prioritize workload according to service pressures.Fundamental understanding of project and financial management processes.Excellent knowledge of SharePoint and Microsoft Office Suite.

Skills/Abilities/Competencies Required
Demonstrated ability to independently solve complex problems with projects, workflows and processAbility to perform gap analysis of business operations and workflowsDemonstrated ability to problem solve with other members of the team and resolve complex issues. Utilize active listening skills to understand business challenges.Communication: Employ effective interpersonal communication and relationship-building skills.Knowledge of and proficiency with business software, i.e., Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio); SharePoint experience a plus Knowledge of HIPAA Confidentiality and Privacy Policies is desirable.

Supervisory Responsibility

No Direct Reports

Fiscal Responsibility.

The Operations Analyst will be responsible for defining potential ROI of projects, billing and vendor management, and participation in budget preparation, however will not have direct oversight of a budget.

Working Conditions
The hours are usually Monday through Friday 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM but vary according to the demands on this exempt salaried position. Time may be split between corporate offices and in hospital-based environments.

The work environment is very busy and dynamic. Staff is very collaborative and work together to solve issues.

There are often multiple conversations occurring at the same time – the staff needs to be able to handle an environment that is not quiet. The employee is required to travel to any Partners’ facilities to attend off-site meetings. This includes travel to new client sites.

EEO Statement

Partners HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer & by embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under law.

Title: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst, CHICO
FullDescriptions:
At Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced. In major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed Integrated Care Organization and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

You’ll be joining a team focused on the implementation of innovative pediatric payment models and clinical integration to measurably improve the care of our patients and the experience of the providers who care for them. We work with Boston Children’s Hospital (BCH), the Physicians Organizations (PO), the Pediatric Physicians Organization at Children’s (PPOC), and other primary care partners. Our ultimate goal is to develop, launch, and formalize integration and shared clinical programming in order to optimize clinical outcomes for the children we serve.


This Sr. Healthcare Data Analyst is responsible for:
Performing analyses and conducting reporting related to the negotiation, implementation and ongoing maintenance of healthcare contracts with focus on risk and alternative payment arrangements, population health management and clinically integrated care.
Leading analytical projects and collaborating with clinical and administrative staff to ensure that analyses and reports are timely, accurate, meaningful and interpretable
To qualify, you must have:
Bachelor's degree in business, health care administration, finance, Statistics or a closely related field. Master’s degree preferred. Minimum of 3 years of progressively responsible experience in a similar role
Experience working with a variety of tools to access data, write queries, develop programming logic, and conduct and maintain analyses and reports. Working knowledge of claims data and risk arrangement methodology is preferred. Technical awareness of coding systems, data types and data structures used to store clinical, demographic, and financial data in healthcare databases is a plus.

Boston Children’s Hospital offers competitive compensation and unmatched benefits, including a flexible schedule, affordable health, vision and dental insurance, generous levels of time off, 403(b) Retirement Savings plan, Pension, Tuition Reimbursement, cell phone plan discounts and discounted rates on T-passes (50% off). Discover your best.

Boston Children’s Hospital is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Title: Data Analyst, Process Improvement
FullDescriptions:
Data Analyst, Fulfillment Operational Excellence
Wayfair continues to build industry-shaping infrastructure and capabilities in Operations to fuel growth and delight our customers. As part of this journey, we are seeking bright, entrepreneurial specialists to help us drive initiatives related to our most strategic operations topics that will propel Wayfair from $5B to $10B and beyond.
Wayfair is inventing the next generation supply chain for the big and bulky category within ecommerce. The industry and Wayfair are growing rapidly and we have the unique opportunity to shape this evolving business model. Our Operational Excellence team will be at the forefront of this effort as we establish and optimize our end to end operational capabilities. This will be a critical capability as we prepare to scale our network to 3x its current size over the next few years.
Our Operational Excellence team will be the team that enables the continuous improvement of our physical processes across sites, helps establish a culture of waste elimination and defect reduction across the organization, and acts as a central interface & process experts for other stakeholders such as Tech, CastleGate, Product Performance, WDN.
The key role of the business analyst is to uncover actionable insights with data that can be leveraged to drive step-change process improvements within our operations. This person will be empowered to put those insights into action with hands-on project management within our field operations. This role will:
Build and analyze data setsthat touch every aspect of Wayfair operations to identify new opportunities and trends to drive supply chain performance and improve the customer experience
Create new process measuresusing insights gathered by marrying real world operations and back end data sets together
Structure and lead problem solving with senior, cross-functional stakeholders to understand broad strategic requirements from the business, prioritize the opportunities we see in the data, develop innovative levers to tackle those opportunities and set targets for impact
Embed in field operationsto incorporate real world operational insights
Scope and run pilots and projectsto test, refine and scale innovative solutions to the most difficult operational challenges
What You'll Do:
Analyze performance data and metrics to root-cause issues, identify opportunities and provide actionable insights for process improvement
Create and execute project roadmaps to improve flow, standardization, quality and productivity
Report performance trends and improvements to senior management
Contribute to the development of new technology to drive increased efficiency and accuracy
Work cross functionally with groups company-wide, including Fulfillment, Product Performance, Product Management, Engineering, CastleGate and Supplier Operations
Collaborate closely with fulfillment to identify and capture improvement opportunities
Travel to our Fulfillment Centers to learn the current process, build relationships, identify opportunities and ultimately put data driven insights into action
What You'll Need:
A Bachelor Degree, analytics or engineering focus preferred
3 to 6 years of e-commerce, logistics, manufacturing or process improvement experience
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal
Innovative problem-solving skills dissect and determine root causes of problems, and implement solutions
Analytical and comfortable with large data sets and drawing insights from them
A track record of successful negotiation and relationship management skills
An ability to hit the ground running a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter
Demonstrated senior presence, recognized as an effective coach to others
An ability to manage and prioritize projects, and to delegate tasks appropriately
A track record of taking on big challenges and delivering despite obstacles and limited resources
Experience in business and data analytics, Excel, SQL

Title: Clinical Data Analyst
Requirement:
B.S. in related field (e.g. computer science, engineering, information systems, information technology, etc.) or equivalent experience
3-5 years’ experience in healthcare data analytics, ETL development, or clinical informatics
At least 2 years of SQL experience
Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g. Snowflake, RedShift, SQL Server, Oracle), including proficiency in data analysis and loading
Strong understanding of clinical terminologies (e.g. CPT/HCPCS, ICD-9/10, Medi-Span GPI, LOINC, Snomed, etc.) and their uses in healthcare systems
Strong critical thinking and analytical mindset with an ability to perform detailed analyses and summarize findings at appropriate levels of detail using charts, summary statistics, and specific examples
Time management and organizational skills with an ability to juggle multiple tasks and prioritize tasks based on importance and time sensitivity
FullDescriptions:
As a member of the Clinical Informatics team, the Clinical Data Analyst will assist in the development of a large healthcare database that aggregates data from a variety of sources. The Clinical Data Analyst will become an expert in OM1’s data and will assist in answering various questions about the data, ranging from availability/presence of key variables to specific business logic to populate target schemas. The Clinical Data Analyst will also implement source to target mappings in order to transform source data into OM1’s data model, and will interact with technical liaisons at partner/customer organizations to facilitate the transfer and ingestion of source data for use in OM1’s data assets and projects. The analyst will define and implement processes that streamline operations within the clinical informatics team and will ensure high quality outputs by establishing and following operational processes that guarantee data integrity. In performing the above responsibilities, the Clinical Data Analyst will:

Develop a strong understanding of OM1’s source databases by analyzing OM1’s big data assets and providing guidance on how to appropriately transform those assets into OM1’s target schema.
Work with data extracted directly from the backend and warehouses of EMR systems as well as pre- and post- adjudicated medical and pharmacy claims data.
Analyze, integrate, and transform data by working closely with OM1’s research, product, engineering, and data science teams to define data elements, metadata, master/reference data rules, and processes to abstract and integrate data from multiple sources.
Provide input to the engineering team regarding additional tooling that would improve CI processes in areas such as data traceability, quality control, and automation.
Create deliverables such as source to target mappings, data dictionaries/specifications for data marts, and data request documents for data partners, customers, and vendors.
Manage processes to improve the mapping and normalization of content within OM1’s database.
Continuously improve quality control processes to ensure data integrity within OM1’s data asset.
Requirements
B.S. in related field (e.g. computer science, engineering, information systems, information technology, etc.) or equivalent experience
3-5 years’ experience in healthcare data analytics, ETL development, or clinical informatics
At least 2 years of SQL experience
Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g. Snowflake, RedShift, SQL Server, Oracle), including proficiency in data analysis and loading
Strong understanding of clinical terminologies (e.g. CPT/HCPCS, ICD-9/10, Medi-Span GPI, LOINC, Snomed, etc.) and their uses in healthcare systems
Strong critical thinking and analytical mindset with an ability to perform detailed analyses and summarize findings at appropriate levels of detail using charts, summary statistics, and specific examples
Time management and organizational skills with an ability to juggle multiple tasks and prioritize tasks based on importance and time sensitivity

PREFERRED
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
At least one year of experience scripting processes using a scripting or programming language such as Python, Unix/Linux Shell, Perl, Java, or other programming language

Title: Business Analyst / Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Business Data Analyst for SharkNinja's Engineering Team will identify and implement changes to existing processes, metrics, and systems in support of optimizing engineering organizational efficiencies to achieve product delivery targets. Working as a member of the Engineering Operations team, the analyst will work closely with global senior leaders and staff to identify actionable metrics, audit points, source data, develop reporting and analytics, and monitor key performance indicators and metrics. The analyst must be a self-starter, an advocate of change, possess strong verbal and written communication skills and be willing to engage functional teams across the global organization.

Responsibilities:
Partner with the various Engineering disciplines and cross-functional teams to identify, analyze and report on short-term and long-term key operational performance metrics.
Design and build automated, dashboards and reports that enable the Engineers to access, explore and monitor their data.
Implement self-service tools for dashboards and reporting.
Train and support the Engineering team in the use of self-service data exploration and visualization tools.
Analyze variability from trends; exploring data and communicating findings to influence strategies and behaviors.
Implement new data analysis methodologies.
Perform ad-hoc analysis as necessary.Source data across various repositories and platforms, internal and cloud.
Research and implement new systems and tools.Analyze license requirements for new and existing software systems.

Qualifications:
Bachelors degree
3-5 years of either Business Analysis or Data Analysis experience
Ability to work in a very fast-paced environment
Flexibility and ability to adapt to project needs
Experience with Excel, SQL and Domo preferred
At SharkNinja, our purpose is to positively impact people’s lives every day in every home around the world. We work very hard to provide our consumers with high quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation, and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to create the next big thing. We take a team approach to our projects, where everyone has a voice. We want individuals to push limits, look outside the box and think the unthinkable. With the explosive growth we have been experiencing, we’re looking for motivated individuals to join us on our exciting journey. People need to think big, move fast and want to make a significant impact. Are you ready?

#LI-GM1
Company Summary
Zeta is a data-driven marketing technology innovator whose SaaS-based marketing cloud helps 500+ Fortune 1000 and Middle Market brands acquire, retain and grow customer relationships through actionable data, advanced analytics and machine learning.
Founded by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley (former CEO of Apple and Pepsi-Cola) in 2007, the company's highly-rated ZetaHub technology platform has been recognized in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Digital Marketing Hubs (February 2017) and in its Magic Quadrant for Multichannel Campaign Management (April 2017), competing with offerings from Oracle, IBM, Salesforce and Adobe.
Operating on four continents with 1,300+ employees, the company is headquartered in New York City, with Centers of Excellence in Silicon Valley, Boston, London, and Hyderabad, India.
