Title: Neuroimaging Data Analyst
Qualifications:
B.A., B.S. or equivalent with background in neuroscience, computer science, engineering or related fields. Masters or PhD degree preferred but not required. 2+ years of prior technical experience.
Quantitative and extremely proficient with multiple neuroimaging analysis platforms (e.g. HCP Pipeline and Workbench, FreeSurfer, SPM, FSL, AFNI, etc.).
Strong programming skills and comfort with diverse computing environments required.
Strong background in statistics and statistical software scripting (R preferred).
Strong background creating scientific figures and writing technical scientific reports.
Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of organization with careful attention to detail are absolutely required. This position requires a high degree of motivation and self‐sufficiency, although extensive training and supervision will be provided.
Responsibilities:
Implement and support statistical analyses and processing pipelines/scripts for behavioral, EEG and multimodal neuroimaging analysis, including resting‐state and task-based fMRI, DTI and volumetric data.
Assist in the creation of databases, query tools for data mining, and documentation on their effective use. Behavioral (RedCap, etc.) and neuroimaging databases (XNAT, etc.) are emphasized.
Maintain quality control and integrity of neuroimaging and behavioral data by developing, implementing and overseeing data entry and QC protocols.
Implement web-based behavioral questionnaires (e.g. RedCap) and program behavioral tasks with presentation software (e.g. Psychophysics Toolbox, PsychoPy, Presentation).
Provide programming and analysis support for lab members.
Coordinate general lab computer/network administration (including data management and archiving).
Assist with the preparation of scientific reports and publications.
FullDescriptions:
NEUROIMAGING RESEARCH AND DATA ANALYST
LABORATORY FOR NEUROPSYCHIATRY AND NEUROMODULATION
MASSACHUSETTS GENERAL HOSPITAL, HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOL

Background:

The Laboratory for Neuropsychiatry and Neuromodulation at the Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School, is seeking a full time Research and Data Analyst for a series of exciting large-scale projects aimed at understanding circuit dynamics underlying neuropsychiatric disorders and their treatments. The laboratory is a multidisciplinary group conducting clinical, translational and basic human neuroscience research with healthy and neuropsychiatric populations, using device-based neuromodulation interventions (TMS, tDCS, ECT, DBS, etc.), neuroimaging, EEG, behavioral and clinical methods. The program includes the Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) clinical service, tightly integrated with our research mission, where we provide individualized treatments for neuropsychiatric patients.

Duties and Responsibilities:
The Scientific and Data Analyst responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Implement and support statistical analyses and processing pipelines/scripts for behavioral, EEG and multimodal neuroimaging analysis, including resting‐state and task-based fMRI, DTI and volumetric data.
Assist in the creation of databases, query tools for data mining, and documentation on their effective use. Behavioral (RedCap, etc.) and neuroimaging databases (XNAT, etc.) are emphasized.
Maintain quality control and integrity of neuroimaging and behavioral data by developing, implementing and overseeing data entry and QC protocols.
Implement web-based behavioral questionnaires (e.g. RedCap) and program behavioral tasks with presentation software (e.g. Psychophysics Toolbox, PsychoPy, Presentation).
Provide programming and analysis support for lab members.
Coordinate general lab computer/network administration (including data management and archiving).
Assist with the preparation of scientific reports and publications.

Qualifications

Qualifications:

B.A., B.S. or equivalent with background in neuroscience, computer science, engineering or related fields. Masters or PhD degree preferred but not required. 2+ years of prior technical experience.
Quantitative and extremely proficient with multiple neuroimaging analysis platforms (e.g. HCP Pipeline and Workbench, FreeSurfer, SPM, FSL, AFNI, etc.).
Strong programming skills and comfort with diverse computing environments required.
Strong background in statistics and statistical software scripting (R preferred).
Strong background creating scientific figures and writing technical scientific reports.
Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of organization with careful attention to detail are absolutely required. This position requires a high degree of motivation and self‐sufficiency, although extensive training and supervision will be provided.
Additional Qualifications:
Experience with neuroimaging and behavioral databases.
Experience with graph analyses, machine learning and modeling confer a significant advantage.
Experience with EEG analysis is preferred.
Graphic or Web design skills are considered a plus.

EEO Statement

Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.

Title: Data Warehouse Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Educational Tours helps students gain new perspectives and build skills for the future through experiential learning. As an accredited institution, we partner with educators across the world to create global education programs that blend classroom, digital, and experiential learning for students.
The Tours Engineering team @ EF Tours is the group of engineering and creative professionals empowering EF to send groups of students and educators on guided educational tours across the world. We power every step of our customer’s journey – from showcasing our tour offerings, to creating personalized itineraries, and collecting their feedback after the tour. Over the course of your career with Tours Engineering, you’ll have the opportunity to build beautiful front-end interactions for our customers, solve large scale data optimization problems, and get your hands on everything in between.
What you’ll do:
You will be part of a cross-functional, largely autonomous data team, collaborating closely with analysts, data scientists, engineers and executive stakeholders in building a single source of truth. You’ll maintain and evolve our mature BI platform on SQL Server, optimize the existing Kimball data marts as they grow, build new models or data marts and support the many data analyst teams in further building and accessissing processed data. You will additionally be involved in augmenting the mature platform as we transition it to a data lake leveraging all the latest tools available anchoring on AWS resources.
Who you are:
To succeed in this role, you’ll need excellent problem-solving skills, strong attention to detail, and the technical know-how to independently build solutions from start to finish. We are looking for a true expert on data modeling, who is comfortable working with datasets of varying latencies and size and disparate platforms.
We ask that you have:
7+ years of hands-on industry experience with data modeling and working in Business Intelligence
Extensive expertise with Microsoft SQL Server (2016+), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), ETL, Replication and Transact-SQL
Advanced SQL expertise with multi-stage transformations and usage of more sophisticated transformation tools and methods, such as windowing functions and temp tables in Transact-SQL
Demonstrable experience implementing business logic into models that have been successfully applied for BI
Excellent verbal and written skills in order to effectively communicate business concepts to partner analysts and teams
Applied experience with relational modeling, star schemas and Kimball Data Warehousing
A drive to learn the intricacies of the business, with a versatile and dynamic understanding of businesses you’ve worked with in the past
1+ years of experience working with Python
Other useful skills include:
Experience with cloud hosting (AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience with NoSQL/Non-relational databases, especially document stores
Experience defining and implementing a global data catalog for end user reference
A working knowledge of modeling with Analysis Services, both on-prem and Azure
Familiarity modeling for BI visualization tools such as Power BI
Let’s talk about the Perks:
We believe that happy people do great work. What makes us happy? Things like:
The opportunity to travel internationally
Discounts on travel
Three weeks paid vacation for your first year and then four weeks after your first year
Free language classes, taught in-house
Access to a brand-new fitness center and rock-climbing wall on the EF campus
A restaurant and bar located in 2 of our EF campus buildings
Market-leading benefits package including top of the line health coverage, 401k with company match, tuition reimbursement, and more…
EF is the world’s largest international education company – providing life-changing educational experiences to create global citizens. We offer millions of people the opportunity to learn a language, travel abroad, experience another culture or earn an academic degree. Since 1965, EF’s mission has been opening the world through education. Our 52,000 employees have a worldwide presence in over 600 schools and offices within 50 countries.
For more information about Education Tours, visit https://www.eftours.com
For more information about our career opportunities, visit www.careers.ef.com

Title: Senior Analyst, Merchandising Analytics
FullDescriptions:
Who We Are:
Wayfair offers a zillion things home and is reinventing the way people shop for their homes. The Merchandising department onboards and maintains the vast product catalog, developing strategies to effectively guide our customers through this large selection and help them find exactly what they need. We are looking for a highly analytical, disciplined, and execution-oriented senior analyst for our North America Merchandising Analytics team. The Merch Analytics team serves as a central counterpart for all Merchandising teams and develops analytics products, on both a stand-alone basis as well as jointly with build partners including Business Intelligence, Data Science, Competitive Intelligence and Product Management.
The ideal candidate brings structured thinking, a strong bias for action, and the technical aptitude to develop new analytics products for the business. We value technical project experience in a fast-paced organization, where a collaborative spirit and great communication skills are critical. We welcome applications from across a range of backgrounds and experiences.
What You ll Do:
Translate complex business problems into specific questions that can be answered through data-driven analysis.
Work with build partner teams in Business Intelligence, Web Analytics, Data Science, and Engineering to identify requirements, obtain buy-in for methodology, architect, develop, and then integrate data/reporting solutions into daily operational processes.
Develop a strong working relationship with Merchandising business partners and a deep understanding of their key business metrics, levers, strategy and goals.
Communicate findings with a clear point of view and compelling visualizations so your insights can be used to help drive business strategy and technology projects
Example projects:
Code SQL scripts to define business logic for new KPIs as new tools and table structures are created by Merch Product Engineering teams.
Partner with Business Intelligence to re-architect data models for evolving data sets such as Voice of the Customer (i.e. reviews/returns) or Product Catalog Maintenance.
Enhance data ingestion and/or pipeline processes to facilitate data integration into business tools and workflows.
What You ll Need:
2+ years of experience in technology or other highly analytical roles
A strong academic record with a background in Computer Science, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, Management or other quantitative preferred
Organized and process-oriented with proven ability to thrive in a high-growth, entrepreneurial environment
Strong technical aptitude and business acumen with demonstrated experience leveraging data from a multitude of sources to solve complex problems
Excellent communication and data presentation skills
Experience with SQL or other database technologies and a demonstrated ability to learn new technologies
Technical proficiency in Python, R, Tableau preferred
About Us
Wayfair is one of the world s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That s why we re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2018, we had more than 34,000 employees, over 82,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 28 million customers. As of December 31, 2018, we had over $1.1 trillion (US$794 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $29.0 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations in Asia, Canada and the United States are where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Title: Data Analyst, Operational Excellence
FullDescriptions:
Data Analyst, Fulfillment Operational Excellence
Wayfair continues to build industry-shaping infrastructure and capabilities in Operations to fuel growth and delight our customers. As part of this journey, we are seeking bright, entrepreneurial specialists to help us drive initiatives related to our most strategic operations topics that will propel Wayfair from $5B to $10B and beyond.
Wayfair is inventing the next generation supply chain for the big and bulky category within ecommerce. The industry and Wayfair are growing rapidly and we have the unique opportunity to shape this evolving business model. Our Operational Excellence team will be at the forefront of this effort as we establish and optimize our end to end operational capabilities. This will be a critical capability as we prepare to scale our network to 3x its current size over the next few years.
Our Operational Excellence team will be the team that enables the continuous improvement of our physical processes across sites, helps establish a culture of waste elimination and defect reduction across the organization, and acts as a central interface & process experts for other stakeholders such as Tech, CastleGate, Product Performance, WDN.
The key role of the business analyst is to uncover actionable insights with data that can be leveraged to drive step-change process improvements within our operations. This person will be empowered to put those insights into action with hands-on project management within our field operations. This role will:
Build and analyze data setsthat touch every aspect of Wayfair operations to identify new opportunities and trends to drive supply chain performance and improve the customer experience
Create new process measuresusing insights gathered by marrying real world operations and back end data sets together
Structure and lead problem solving with senior, cross-functional stakeholders to understand broad strategic requirements from the business, prioritize the opportunities we see in the data, develop innovative levers to tackle those opportunities and set targets for impact
Embed in field operationsto incorporate real world operational insights
Scope and run pilots and projectsto test, refine and scale innovative solutions to the most difficult operational challenges
What You'll Do:
Analyze performance data and metrics to root-cause issues, identify opportunities and provide actionable insights for process improvement
Create and execute project roadmaps to improve flow, standardization, quality and productivity
Report performance trends and improvements to senior management
Contribute to the development of new technology to drive increased efficiency and accuracy
Work cross functionally with groups company-wide, including Fulfillment, Product Performance, Product Management, Engineering, CastleGate and Supplier Operations
Collaborate closely with fulfillment to identify and capture improvement opportunities
Travel to our Fulfillment Centers to learn the current process, build relationships, identify opportunities and ultimately put data driven insights into action
What You'll Need:
A Bachelor Degree, analytics or engineering focus preferred
3 to 6 years of e-commerce, logistics, manufacturing or process improvement experience
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal
Innovative problem-solving skills dissect and determine root causes of problems, and implement solutions
Analytical and comfortable with large data sets and drawing insights from them
A track record of successful negotiation and relationship management skills
An ability to hit the ground running a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter
Demonstrated senior presence, recognized as an effective coach to others
An ability to manage and prioritize projects, and to delegate tasks appropriately
A track record of taking on big challenges and delivering despite obstacles and limited resources
Experience in business and data analytics, Excel, SQL

Title: Senior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Cogniscient Media (the Media arm of MARC USA) is hiring an experienced Data Analytics star for our Charlestown / Boston office. This position will focus on Digital Media. Our Senior Analysts work with agency and client teams to plan, measure, and optimize digital media campaigns. This position plays a lead role in defining strategic testing and measurement plans, designing and building custom reports and dashboards, and translating complex analyses into meaningful insights and recommendations. This individual should have strong attention to detail, excellent communication and presentation skills, and experience analyzing and modeling data from a variety of sources.

Here's what you'll do in your Data Analytics role:
Develop and own campaign measurement strategies and reporting solutions for clients across a wide range of industries
Utilize a variety of web analytics, data management and B.I. tools (Google Analytics, DART, SQL, Excel, Power BI, etc.)
Extract, transform, load and blend data from multiple sources, while maintaining strict standards for data quality and accuracy
Design and develop custom client-facing reports and dashboards to visualize key patterns and trends
Lead conversations with cross-agency teams to develop data-driven insights and recommendations, optimize media performance, and identify opportunities to deliver added value and enhance client relationships
Work with data science teams to develop testing strategies and contribute to advanced analytics projects (segmentation, attribution, media mix, etc.)
Develop and present findings to clients and senior-level stakeholders
Serve as a guide and mentor for Analysts and Associate Analysts
Contribute to team growth and development initiatives (L&D, team building, professional development, recruiting, etc.)
To excel in this position, you should have the following:
Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Economics, Math, Statistics, Data Analytics or a related field
3-5 years of data analytics experience required
Proven advanced data manipulation and analysis skills in SQL and Excel (familiarity with Microsoft Power BI, DOMO, VBA a plus)
Familiarity with digital media campaigns and channels (paid search, display, social, etc.) preferred
Please visit us at www.marcusa.com or https://cogniscientmedia.com/

Title: Development Analyst
FullDescriptions:
UDR is excited to announce an opening for a Development Analyst at our Regional Office in Boston, MA.


GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES: Work with senior members of the development team to analyze the profitability of potential deals, model development proformas, and gather market/rent comp data. Assist in providing financial analysis, modeling, and support for all the Company’s new business development activities in the real estate industry. Provide research and analysis on various topics related to various projects. Participate in the management of active developments.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Reports directly to a Development Associate, Director – Development or Senior Director – Development


SUPERVISION EXERCISED: N/A

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

1. Produce financial modeling spreadsheets.
2. Build and maintain reports and databases on land sales, forward supply, market data, and other statistics.
3. Receive, analyze, and summarize market studies. Establish intimate knowledge base of target markets.
4. Assist in the creation and assembly of presentations, investment memos, design update memos, and other correspondence utilizing PowerPoint, Excel and MS Word.
5. Attend Owner-Architect-Contractor (“OAC”) meetings to support the development of project program and design.
6. Track project expenditures versus budget. Maintain financial forecasts for active developments.
7. Research local property tax rates, local impact fees, and entitlement costs to ensure an accurate reflection of total development costs.
8. Review third-party market reports to supplement the organizations’ operating data in order to make appropriate operating and expense projections for the proposed development.
9. Work with other members of the development team during the due diligence process to ensure issues related to the potential impact on project performance are reviewed. Provide sensitivity analysis to evaluate the impact of certain variables.
10. Review and summarize city documents.
11. Compile and manage project schedules.
12. Support development managers in tasks such as acquisition of utilities, permits, and other project needs.
13. Monitor and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, federal, state, and local laws and organizational standards. Identify and report potential risk areas and support the problem resolution.

14. Prepare and distribute monthly development reports to senior members of the team.
15. Perform other duties as assigned or as necessary.
Requirements PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: Knowledge of organizational policies and procedures, fiscal management, and office management techniques. Knowledge and understanding of business research principles, processes, and techniques. Ability to apply policies and procedures to solve company issues.

Ability to think conceptually and translate concepts into practical applications solutions and decisions. Ability to demonstrate and execute practical and effective solutions to problems. Must have a strong work ethic, integrity, and good business acumen. Ability to analyze data and recommend strategy. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra, geometry, and statistics.


Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively present information to and respond to questions from management or team members. Ability to establish priorities and coordinate work activities. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.

Knowledge of fiscal management and office management techniques with strong skills regarding spreadsheets, word processing and database applications. Strong experience and demonstrated aptitude with MS Excel. Ability to process computer data and to format and generate reports. Ability to create, compose, and edit written materials.

TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Requires mobility sufficient to travel. Some bending, stooping and stretching. Occasionally lifting items weighing up to 30 lbs. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare, and communicate appropriate reports. Extensive data input and required ability to sit for long periods of time. Regular and consistent attendance on the job is an essential function.

TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS: Normal office environment. Occasional evening or weekend work. Occasional travel may be required. The position will be based in Boston.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

1. Bachelor’s or graduate degree in business, finance, economics, architecture, civil engineering, urban planning, or related field.
2. Minimum of one to two years experience within the real estate industry preferred.
3. Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license unless otherwise noted.

Title: Systems Analyst / 40 Hour / MGH - General Internal Medicine
Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree and a minimum of –3+ years of experience programming, preferably in SAS.
Masters degree strongly preferred in health sciences related field, preferably biostatistics.
Basic knowledge of statistics
Experience manipulating and organizing large amounts of data
Experience with table and query development in a relational database system
Skills:
Excellent communication skills, as much of the incumbent’s work will be summarized in written reports to investigators
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple tasks and deadline pressures
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential data discreetly
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team and to collaborate with team members located remotely
Demonstrated good judgment in all areas of responsibility.
FullDescriptions:
This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst who is interested in the delivery of health care and improving health. This is a full time (40 hours/ week) data analysis position in the Division of General Internal Medicine (DGIM) at the Massachusetts General Hospital. DGIM has major research interests in the delivery of primary care, screening and prevention, and the quality of care. The Senior Data Analyst will be involved in ongoing research projects performing data collection, manipulation, analysis and reporting. This position requires an individual with the ability to work cooperatively with other analysts, as well as strong organizational, data management and quantitative skills.
MGH is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage individuals from under-represented backgrounds to apply.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsibilities include:
Communicate with clinical investigators in DGIM and collaborating research centers to understand scientific issues, determine appropriate statistical analyses, and describe results.
Work with the study team and senior statisticians to develop reporting and quality control plans
Use SAS to generate reports on study progress.
Design and perform statistical analyses. Analyses will incorporate quantitative methods including multivariate statistics and repeated measures analysis.
Develop and document programs to perform complete data validation and error detection, ensuring that all are informed of any issues relating to data integrity
Identify and correct data errors: The analyst will implement strategies to detect and resolve errors in existing datasets.
Maintain patient registries: The analyst will keep prospective patient registries up to date by querying administrative databases, including RPDR, EDW and D4Q, to obtain new data and incorporating it in patient registries maintained in MS Access and SQL Server databases and SAS datasets
Provide senior statisticians with data requests and sample pull lists for Principal Investigators
Perform statistical analysis of data
Assist in manuscript and report preparation
Prepare and proof data tables for manuscripts and presentations.
 Attend research team meetings with Principal Investigators and study staff

Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree and a minimum of –3+ years of experience programming, preferably in SAS.
Masters degree strongly preferred in health sciences related field, preferably biostatistics.
Basic knowledge of statistics
Experience manipulating and organizing large amounts of data
Experience with table and query development in a relational database system
Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities
Excellent communication skills, as much of the incumbent’s work will be summarized in written reports to investigators
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple tasks and deadline pressures
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential data discreetly
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team and to collaborate with team members located remotely
Demonstrated good judgment in all areas of responsibility.


EEO Statement

Massachusetts General Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. Applications from protected veterans and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged.

Shift: Day Job

Previous experience with Bose CE product/engineering/apps
Solid knowledge of data relationship for structure and unstructured data.
Previous experience in research working environment by governing data from internal and external partners.
Work in very dynamic environment where changes are introduced rapidly in the business process, data flow and technologies.
Experience in consumer industry focus on product data, sales and marketing
The ideal candidate will understand how people, process and technology can come together to enable advanced analytics and data management.
Experience in data quality, data governance and supporting tools (Collibra preferably)
Proven experience of cross functional leadership in complex organizations with strong emphasis on influencing and collaboration.
Strong analytical orientation.
Teach, mentor, and provide value on a consistent basis to stakeholders.
Ability to translate strategy into an operational plan and can execute delivering consistent value to Bose.
Responsibilities:
What data is available (Data Catalog)?
Is the data relevant and meaningful (Data classification)?
What does the data mean (Technical/Business metadata, Business Glossary, and Reference Data)?
Where did the data come from (Data Lineage)?
What is the quality of the data (Data Quality)?
Is the data verified (Certified Data)?
How can I get access to the data (Processes)?
Am I in compliance by using this data (Policy)?
FullDescriptions:
Job Posting
Bose is about better sound, but better sound is just the beginning. We’re about inventing new technologies that truly benefit people, and creating a culture where innovation and teamwork are highly valued. Working at Bose, you’re encouraged to question conventional thinking in the relentless quest to create products and experiences that change people's lives. Our culture is as distinctive as our products. Join a company that operates globally, with a culture that embraces new ideas.
We have exciting Business Data Analyst employment opportunities in our Corporate Information Systems team. The team is working to build a world class data driven organization that includes Data Governance enabling advanced analytics and Data Science across Bose. The goal is to have proactive data quality, enable certified data, provide for a searchable data catalog that includes lineage from visualizations to source systems decreasing analytics time to value.
The Business Data Analyst will be supporting and partnering with Consumers Electronics stakeholders.
If you have a passion for creating a data driven culture by delivering value, please consider a career at Bose!
Responsibilities include:
The Business Data Analyst role at Bose is a blend skill set of data management tools (Data Quality, Governance, ERP, CRM and Data Analytics). The Business Data Analyst can speak data, process, business and technical language to add value and benefits solving data problem. He/She will facilitate capturing and documenting business, data, governance and technology assets.
The Business Data Analyst role accelerates advanced analytics and Data Science time to value by executing a framework to answer the following questions:
What data is available (Data Catalog)?
Is the data relevant and meaningful (Data classification)?
What does the data mean (Technical/Business metadata, Business Glossary, and Reference Data)?
Where did the data come from (Data Lineage)?
What is the quality of the data (Data Quality)?
Is the data verified (Certified Data)?
How can I get access to the data (Processes)?
Am I in compliance by using this data (Policy)?
Implement a centralized data governance framework driving Bose to data driven decisions.
Build enterprise systems centralized data catalogs enabling collaboration across functions and simplifying data discovery.
Provide support to source systems and enterprise analytical platforms classifying data, adding data usage, and providing use case context around the data.
Define and capture business and technical metadata to provide context, meaning and searchability around data and the data catalog. Define critical data elements business terms to drive common semantics across Bose. Build reference data and relate it to the critical data elements.
Identify, define, measure data quality and develop critical data elements (CDEs) logical and physical lineage including data flow diagrams providing insight into focus areas applying a data governance framework.
Organize Data Governance councils including functional stakeholders to align with the centralized Data Governance framework.
Deliver education, training, and consulting across Bose to be an ambassador for driving data driven culture across Bose.
Discover key stakeholders of data including owners, subject matter experts and existing Business Data Analysts.
Work with cross-functional Business Data Analysts to understand, document and improve processes to access data (from request to provisioning). Streamline across Bose to reduce complexity executing workshops and aligning process stakeholders/owners.
Provides support of Data Science and Advanced Analytics project/programs reducing administrative data governance tasks and action items.
Partner with Legal, Information Security and HR to ensure compliance and security of data including how to manage data (masking, encrypting, pseudonymizing, synonymizing).
Develop and align centralized policies and standards providing a baseline for functional policies.
Develop and execute quarterly plans while aligning to Bose strategic vision.
Track and measure wins including return on investment measuring quarterly governance results and value delivered.
Skills, Knowledge and Experiences
Candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of Master Data Management and solid experience understanding a Data Governance framework.
Previous experience with Bose CE product/engineering/apps
Solid knowledge of data relationship for structure and unstructured data.
Previous experience in research working environment by governing data from internal and external partners.
Work in very dynamic environment where changes are introduced rapidly in the business process, data flow and technologies.
Experience in consumer industry focus on product data, sales and marketing
The ideal candidate will understand how people, process and technology can come together to enable advanced analytics and data management.
Experience in data quality, data governance and supporting tools (Collibra preferably)
Proven experience of cross functional leadership in complex organizations with strong emphasis on influencing and collaboration.
Strong analytical orientation.
Teach, mentor, and provide value on a consistent basis to stakeholders.
Ability to translate strategy into an operational plan and can execute delivering consistent value to Bose.
Other
Passion for Data and Governance.
Bachelor’s degree.
Knowledge of MS Office.
Experience using data quality and data governance tools is a plus.
Relocation is not available for this position

Title: Unified Data Hub Use Case Analyst
FullDescriptions:
ROLE SUMMARY
The PGS Manufacturing & Engineering Solutions Team is responsible for the delivery of Pfizer’s Core Digital Manufacturing Operations Management (MoM) capabilities at every level of the PGS Plant Network (ISA 95 Levels 0-4). These solutions are critical to Manufacturing Execution, Manufacturing Process Intelligence and Production Optimization that aim to improve product quality, increase asset utilization/uptime, automate manual workflows and streamline plant floor operations. The PGS Manufacturing & Engineering Solutions Team provides common application platforms and solution capabilities for Digital Plant, Manufacturing Operations, Manufacturing Execution, Manufacturing Excellence and Manufacturing & Engineering Technology solutions, while ensuring a unified User Centric Design. Key to the success of this transformative digital mindset is the secure, seamless flow of contextualized data from the device & control levels, all the way to the top of the Enterprise. These solutions are deployed across more than fifty manufacturing & center locations across the PGS Globally. Major Core Solutions and team capabilities for the Manufacturing Excellence Solutions team include:
Manufacturing Excellence Solutions: PGS Unified Data Hub, IMEx Analytics, Batch Tracker and Manufacturing Intelligence
The Unified Data Hub Use Case Analyst colleague will be responsible for identifying high-value operations use cases across Pfizer’s network of 60+ manufacturing sites. For each use case, he or she will work closely with other data and analytics team members to supply the use cases with pipelines of data through Pfizer’s Unifed Data Hub (UDH). The UDH is a cloud-based data lake, data warehouse and data science workbench (DSWB) that centralizes Pfizer’s high volumes of disparate data for use by an analytics community of practice. This role includes solution governance, change management, functional design, release management, enhancement request assessments, solution vendor technical relationship management, data management, report management, deployment support, audit support, and integration support for solutions that depend on data from the UDH and DSWB.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
The Unified Data Hub Use Case Analyst colleague’s responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Fosters an environment that thrives on curiosity
Always strives for greater efficiency across all of Pfizer’s data systems
Builds data and analytics tools that will offer deeper insight into the pipeline, allowing for critical discoveries surrounding key performance indicators
Acts independently on self-initiated projects. Leverages knowledge from others related to overall objectives, strategy, critical issues and policy matters
Influences senior management decisions that impact business direction
Ensures proper Systems Development Lifecycle Management (e.g. GMP Regulatory Compliance)
Conducts change management (SOP-00022)
Collaborates with key stakeholders across PGS, D&T and Strategic Partners
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree
7+ years of experience managing project lifecycle activities and management of stakeholder expectations
Ability to work across multiple concurrent activities and successfully adapt to changing priorities as required
Strong process and procedure skills, most particularly regarding stakeholder management
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Experience working with and extracting value from large, disconnected and/or unstructured datasets
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with the following tools and technologies:
Relational SQL databases
Experience in all lifecycle phases of managing SaaS/cloud-based solutions
Experience with Agile Software Delivery and/or Scrum Master Certification
PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to perform mathematical calculations
Ability to manage many parallel objectives and changing priorities
Ability to understand complex interrelationships between system components and design/implementation decisions
NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
Ability to travel up to 50% and must be able to support weekend or night cutover and/or upgrade activities
Adhere to safe work practices and procedures such as aseptic gowning
OTHER INFORMATION
Last Date to Apply for Job: October 17, 2019
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.

Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Title: Senior Data Analyst
Qualifications: Ability to work closely with senior leadership and external stakeholders
Responsibilities: Track to the successful delivery of high priority projects across multiple programs, including ACO, CP, and DSRIP implementations.
Requirement: Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division’s Hiring Guidelines
FullDescriptions:
The mission of MassHealth is to improve the health outcomes of our diverse members, their families and their communities by providing access to integrated health care services that sustainably promote health, well-being, independence and quality of life.
The Executive Office of Health and Human Services (EOHHS) is the largest executive agency in state government and oversees expenditures of approximately $19.4 billion annually. EOHHS has approximately 22,000 employees and serves approximately 2 million clients. Our collective mission as a secretariat is to improve the quality of life and health of all people, particularly vulnerable populations and children, by advancing wellness and improving health care quality, fostering safe homes and communities, promoting self-sufficiency, and furthering the use of community-based supports and resources.

The Payment Reform Implementation Project Manager will report directly to the Director of Payment Reform Implementation. This position will be responsible for tracking and supporting the team’s progress towards the timely delivery of many highly-interdependent and high-priority work streams supporting implementation of this program. Successful delivery of these projects requires strong collaboration with project leads from several units of the organization as well as working closely with the top leadership of MassHealth.

Duties and Responsibilities (these duties are a general summary and not all inclusive):
Track to the successful delivery of high priority projects across multiple programs, including ACO, CP, and DSRIP implementations.
Manage these programs across a matrixed organization, comprised of discrete teams from program/policy, internal IT, data warehouse, operations, and external contractors.
Maintain the MS Project-based master timeline across the Payment and Care Delivery Reform team via weekly status update meetings.
Ensure each major work stream and associated workgroups within each effort have clear ownership and accountability.
Well-defined escalation processes.
Effective means of communication (e.g., regular meetings, emails distribution lists, internal message boards.)
Proactive risk mitigation and management.
Ask and dig into potentially problematic areas, ensure team has through trough unintended consequences and aware of cross-program interdependences.
Work with teams on resolving any issues and escalate to management as needed.
Coordinate and track resource allocation and timely flag any deficiencies.
Coordinate regular, and ad hoc, communication and updates.
Present regular status updates to MassHealth senior leadership, including Assistant Secretary for MassHealth/Medicaid Director and Chief of Payment and Care Delivery Reform.
Own the creation and content management of monthly status updates to the Governor’s team and Secretary of the Executive Office of Health and Human Services.
Be prepared, on an as needed basis, to create and support status updates
Develop content expertise on priority efforts and sub-streams.
Perform other similar and related duties as required or as directed.

Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to work closely with senior leadership and external stakeholders
Ability to manage work streams involving multiple cross functional teams
Excellent organizational skills with a particular focus upon managing details
Strong time management and analytical skills
Comfort with multitasking
Comfort with working under high pressure and tight time constraints
Prior experience in project management and/or program management
Background in healthcare management or policy preferred
Functional knowledge of payer claims systems, data warehouse processes, information exchanges, and information technology
Outstanding listening and communication skills—both written and oral
PMP Certification a plus

Total Compensation:
As an employee of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, you are offered a great career opportunity influencing a wide-spectrum of services to the diverse populations we serve - but it's more than a paycheck. The State's total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits which you should consider towards your overall compensation, including:

Title: Business Analyst / Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The Business Data Analyst for SharkNinja's Engineering Team will identify and implement changes to existing processes, metrics, and systems in support of optimizing engineering organizational efficiencies to achieve product delivery targets. Working as a member of the Engineering Operations team, the analyst will work closely with global senior leaders and staff to identify actionable metrics, audit points, source data, develop reporting and analytics, and monitor key performance indicators and metrics. The analyst must be a self-starter, an advocate of change, possess strong verbal and written communication skills and be willing to engage functional teams across the global organization.

Responsibilities:
Partner with the various Engineering disciplines and cross-functional teams to identify, analyze and report on short-term and long-term key operational performance metrics.
Design and build automated, dashboards and reports that enable the Engineers to access, explore and monitor their data.
Implement self-service tools for dashboards and reporting.
Train and support the Engineering team in the use of self-service data exploration and visualization tools.
Analyze variability from trends; exploring data and communicating findings to influence strategies and behaviors.
Implement new data analysis methodologies.
Perform ad-hoc analysis as necessary.Source data across various repositories and platforms, internal and cloud.
Research and implement new systems and tools.Analyze license requirements for new and existing software systems.

Bachelors degree
3-5 years of either Business Analysis or Data Analysis experience
Ability to work in a very fast-paced environment
Flexibility and ability to adapt to project needs
Experience with Excel, SQL and Domo preferred

FullDescriptions:
About Us

As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

General Duties

Data Analysis: Responsible for helping to facilitate the development of end-user requirements; documenting such requirements and working with people analytics management and business staff to implement these requirements. Collaborate with HR, Finance and business analyst experts in testing and validation of data for accuracy. Data analytics tends to be project-based, centered on one or more of the following areas:

Optimizing and implementing (new) data processes and systems.Maintain HR data tools, reporting and dashboards.Produce and deliver standard (monthly, quarterly, and annual) and customized HR reports.Respond to HR data requests on an ad hoc basis by gathering, analyzing, and reporting relevant data from various sources.Maintain HR data integrity by ensuring accuracy and consistency of input data. Audit HR data and troubleshoot irregularities. Support data governance processes.Develop & maintain a data glossary,Responsible for master data entry.Collaborate with HR and Finance on system upgrades and analysesResponsible for addressing a high volume of system-related activities in a timely fashion while maintaining a high level of quality and internal customer satisfaction.
Accountability

Holds self and others accountable for all works activities, research and personal actions and decisions; follows through on commitments and focuses on those activities that have the greatest impact on meeting measurable high quality results for PHS People Analytics’ success. In conjunction with Partners HealthCare mission, exercises ethical practices, respectful words and behaviors, and equitable treatment of other in all activities.

Special Projects
Develops, analyzes and review project as assigned by Analytics Director.

Title: Health Data Analyst

FullDescriptions:
IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Linguamatics is a leading provider of text mining solutions with a strong presence in healthcare. Thanks to a great core team and innovative use of semantic and natural language processing (NLP) technology, our I2E software is deployed in a number of industries and is acknowledged as the foremost solution in the healthcare and life sciences sector.

We are now looking for someone with experience of processing electronic medical records. The candidate will have strong programming skills to work on solution-focussed resources that assist customers in applying Natural Language Processing to the processing of electronic health records. The post will be in our Research and Resource Development Team in the US, ideally based at our Marlborough office.

Key tasks and responsibilitiesBuild and maintain resources to assist our customers in using Natural Language Processing for healthcare applicationsContribute to consulting engagements with customers to provide solutionsDevelop text mining strategies for use cases in healthcareHelp extend and develop domain specific terminologiesDeliver high-quality solutions on-time

Requirements
The ideal candidate will have the following skills, experience and qualifications:
Strong programming skills with knowledge of a scripting language, preferably PythonFamiliarity with the software life cycle and commercial developmentAcademic or commercial experience in processing electronic health recordsKnowledge of text mining and/or enterprise searchFamiliarity with ontologies and coding systemsAbility to work to deadlines whilst maintaining quality and attention to detailA pro-active attitude with good communication and team-working skills

This is a challenging and exciting role. If you think you have the right skills and experience, and are ready to make an outstanding contribution to the team and the success of our business, please send your application.
Join Us
Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.
Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

FullDescriptions:
This is a limited, 1 year position with the possibility of continuing further. This is a grant funded position and is not eligible for severance pay.


The Jonathan M. Tisch College of Civic Life prepares Tufts students to become active citizens and community leaders. As the only university-wide college of its kind, its mission is to engage Tufts students in meaningful community building, public service experiences, and transformational learning. It conducts and supports groundbreaking research on civic and political participation and forges innovative community partnerships. Tisch College is a national leader in civic education, whose model and research are setting the standard for higher education’s role in civic engagement.
The Institute for Democracy and Higher Education (IDHE) studies and works to strengthen college student political learning, participation, and equity. IDHE’s signature initiative, the National Study of Learning, Voting, and Engagement is both a service to higher education institutions – providing colleges universities with institution-level data on their students’ registration and voting – and a national database for research. NSLVE currently includes over 800 campuses from across the country.

This is a limited, 1 year position with the possibility of continuing further. IDHE conducts both quantitative and qualitative research on college student political learning and engagement. Its signature initiative, the National Study of Learning, Voting and Engagement (NSLVE) is the nation’s only objective study of college student civic engagement and voting. With more than 1,000 participating institutions and a database of student voting records for 10 million students for each of the 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2018 elections, NSLVE is a significant database for research. Under the direction of the Program Data Manager and in collaboration with the IDHE research team, s/he will contribute to database management, analysis, data visualization, report preparation and research & evaluation projects. The analyst will work on multiple projects simultaneously and must be capable of merging, cleaning, organizing and storing data and maintaining an accurate and efficient data dissemination process.

Qualifications

Basic Requirements:

3 years of related experience.
Bachelor’s degree OR demonstrated competencies in relevant skills.
Proficiency using a statistical software package such as R, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Data management and analysis skills.
Data visualization experience.
Prior experience in querying data sets.
Experience with diverse stakeholders of varied educational and professional backgrounds and perspectives.
Keen attention to details and ability to manage multiple project deliverables and timelines.
Effective verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
Ability to gather and analyze available data and draw logical conclusions.
Ability to work on several projects simultaneously and meet demanding timelines.
Ability to compose accurate and clearly written reports and documents.
Ability to work independently within basic guidelines and parameters.
A history of collaboration and team work.
Proactive problem solving and critical thinking/analysis skills.
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in higher education.
Experience with voting data.
Experience in data visualization software and website management.
Exposure to large datasets, querying tools, and/or database programming language such as SQL.
Exposure to logic models, research design, statistical analysis (multivariate statistics), and quantitative research methods.

An employee in this position must complete all appropriate background checks at the time of hire, promotion, or transfer.

Title: Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Data Analyst interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to make informed decisions to improve college processes and operations. The Data Analyst gathers information from various internal and external systems and interprets patterns and trends while acting as a technical resource member of the Information Technology team. The role is responsible for resolving data-related support requests as well as meeting customer satisfaction and continuous service delivery demands. The Data Analyst will report directly to the Director of Information Technology.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize institutional and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
To accurately record, update and document requests using the IT helpdesk system.
To maintain a first-class level of customer service ensuring that all customers are treated efficiently and in an appropriate manner.
Maintain excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels in the organization.
To be a highly motivated team player with the skills and ability to manage changing priorities.
To create, maintain and publish relevant support documentation in order to assist all faculty/staff/students in the quick resolution of their service requests.
Undertaking other duties not specifically stated which from time to time are necessary without altering the nature or level of responsibility
EDUCATION/ EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree preferred in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.
Recent work experience providing relevant support may be substituted in lieu of degree.
Preferred 1-3 years experience in higher education or learning environment.

Title: Data Analyst/Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Waystar modernizes the healthcare revenue cycle through innovative, cloud-based technology. We provide the highest-rated client experience to more than 450,000 providers, 22,000 healthcare organizations and 750 health systems and hospitals around the country. Together, our technology, data and client support streamline workflows and improve financials for our clients, so that they can focus on their patients. We are deeply committed to living out our organizational values: honesty; passion; curiosity; fanatical focus; best work, always; making it happen; and joyful, optimistic and fun.

Waystar is seeking a talented and energetic, data-driven analyst to play a key role on our Ops Engineering team. In this role, you will apply an analytical approach to enhance the delivery and exchange of data insights to our growing client base.

The successful Data Analyst/Business Analyst will have a passion for data, analytics, and problem solving and who will not only bring their experience to the team, but will also explore new and interesting ways for us to build our analytic capabilities and resources as the business grows.
Looking For Some Details?
Gather, examine, and analyze large sets of data from multiple sources in order to define and diagnose different patterns for data manipulation
Verify, monitor, and optimize data exchanges between Waystar and our clients
Mange data integrity by ensuring the data delivered to clients is being executed as planned
Utilize and create SQL coding to query and manipulate complex data that can be used to automate routine tasks and data reporting
Streamline data reporting to support current growth and improve current processes
Work with clients to understand the data they provide and how that data translates into a common data model that supports driving client business improvement
Develop and refine control reporting for file receipts and transmissions
Compare third party reporting on key metrics as it relates to business activity
Support the Account Management team in efforts to improve process consistency
Perform other general quantitative analysis as it relates to Waystar's business goals
Do You Fit Our Team?
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other related quantitative field
1+ years of experience performing data analysis in a business environment
Experience using SQL Server for complex projects and tasks a plus
Proven experience managing data, including data analysis and problem solving
Familiarity with the challenges of data extraction and manipulation of large data sets
Strong communication skills both written and oral
Attention to detail and strong commitment to quality
Healthcare experience a plus
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
